loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 49 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming banana/coconut in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Anita has been farming banana/coconut for two years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Zulieta

texts.en:
Zulieta is 39 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Zulieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Zulieta requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Zulieta has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zulieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and eggs for her restaurant business.
Erlinda has been in this business for six years. Erlinda earns more income from raising livestock.
Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and eggs

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is already 37 years old. She is married and has four children who all attend school. Her husband is a farmer. They live peacefully in the village of Antagan. 

She maintains a hog-raising business as another source of income. Every three to four months, she usually sells her fattened pigs, after which, she will again buy four piglets to raise and sell when they are fully grown up. Her earnings from the business went toward paying the tuition fees of her children in school. 

Genevieve is doing her best with her husband in farming to get ahead in life and be able to support the education of all their children. To further improve her hog-raising, she wanted to apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] that will be helpful to her in buying sufficient supply of hog feed and medicines needed by her raised pigs.

loans.use: to buy sufficient supply of hog feed and medicines for the pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Arlene works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Arlene is borrowing 30,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a 14,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase more goods like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell in her general store.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years now.

Editha would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like candies, biscuits, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung (in the photo) raises pigs at home. She is 45 years old and lives in a village about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and three daughters. Her son is married and lives separately; two of her daughters attend high school, and another is in university in Phnom Penh and works as well. 
Her husband is a fisherman. Soung is applying for a loan in order to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to university and work. Her daughter rides a bicycle and riding a bicycle is tiring and takes lots of time.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to school and work.

loans.name: Aslibegim

texts.ru: Аслибегим имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Она в течение многих лет работала в средней школе. Она последние годы работает в парикмахерской, так как в школе она имела маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватала для обеспечения ее сына. Она единственная кормилица своего сына, так ее муж погиб в гражданской войне. Аслибегим старается обеспечить своего сына со всеми не обходимыми средствами и дать высшее образование. Ее сын учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США. Она надеется на ваше милосердие и надеется, что этот займ поможет ее сироте получить образование.
texts.en:
Aslibegim has a degree in education.  For many years she worked in a secondary school.  However, for the past few years, she has been working in a beauty salon because her teacher's salary was not enough to provide for her son.   Aslibegim's husband died during the civil war, so she is now the only breadwinner for her son.

Aslibegim tries to provide her son with all the necessities of life and wants to give him a higher education.  Her son is currently a university student, and she needs to pay his tuition fees.  She is taking a loan of $1,000 for this purpose.  She is relying on your generosity and hopes that this loan will help her fatherless son to get an education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is taking a loan of $1,200 to increase the inventory of her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs and fish. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Martina is a hard working woman and she hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs and fish

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 32 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gena is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gena has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from rice sales. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is single with 1 child. She is 51 years old and lives in Tinacla-an,Clarin, Philippines.
Norma sells snacks in the local community to earn a living and has been operating this business for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, egg, milk, oil, cheese, butter, cocoa powder, etc.
Norma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Norma hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as margarine, sugar, flour, egg, milk, oil, cheese, butter, cocoa powder, etc.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 30 year old married woman with 2 children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's cotton factory. 
Her husband has been a cotton factory owner for 2 years. He always fulfills his job efficiently and tries to provide the best quality of work to his clients.
With the loan, Iram will help her husband to purchase more cotton to offer better quality services to his clients. He has great bargaining skills, and his clients are very pleased with his services. 
Iram's personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent home. She is hopeful that the loan will bring a considerable growth to their monthly income through increased profits.

loans.use: to pay for cotton.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es: Yohana tiene 34 años, es madre soltera de un niño de un año y vive junto a sus padres en su vivienda hecha de material noble que construyó con el apoyo de su familia. Tras su separación conyugal optó por poner un negocio dedicado a la venta diversos productos comestibles y para la casa los cuales tienen buena demanda en su localidad, además le agrada vender productos acordes  a fechas festivas ya que ameritan la compra de estos por los habitantes de la localidad donde vive.  Muy aparte de su negocio posee una maquina surtidora de refrescos con el que expende bebidas preparadas a base de maracuyá y maíz,Desea contar con dinero para seguir surtiendo su negocio con mercadería al por mayor para obtener ingresos extras.Sus objetivos a largo plazo esta en iniciar la construcción del tercer piso de su vivienda para así convertirlo a futuro en una casa para el alquiler de cuartos de vivienda y generar ingresos fijos en beneficio de su economía familiar. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con  2,000 nuevos soles e invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor como productos de limpieza entre  jabones, escobillas, detergentes y accesorios menores para el hogar.
texts.en:
Yohana is 34 years old. She is a single mother of a one-year-old son, and she lives with her parents in their house made of fine material that she built with the support of her family. 

After her marriage ended, she decided to start a business dedicated to selling various food and household products, which are in high demand in her area. Additionally, she is happy to sell products coinciding with holiday dates that merit the purchase of these products by residents of the town where she lives. 

Apart from her business, she has a soda fountain machine, with which she sells drinks made from passionfruit and corn. She wants to have money to continue stocking her business with wholesale merchandise in order to obtain extra earnings. 

Her long-term objectives include starting the construction of a third story for her home in order to convert it, in the future, to a house for renting out living quarters and generating regular income for the benefit of her family’s finances. 

This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives for getting ahead. In addition, she is committed to paying off her quotas punctually. With this opportunity, she is hoping to have 2,000 nuevos soles and to invest in the purchase of bulk merchandise for cleaning products such as soap, brushes, detergent, and minor products for the home.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products like soap and detergent, among others.

loans.name: Maria Roselis

texts.es:
Doña María Roselis es ama de casa y madre de 6 hijos los cuales tres de ellos estudian en primaria en una escuela de la comunidad y los tres mayores estudian en el centro de básico de la comunidad donde ella habita. A sus 41 años de edad sigue en la lucha y con muchas fuerzas para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro y en compañía de sus esposo se dedican al cultivo de café en pequeñas parcela que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio han podido comprar. En cuanto a su conocimiento de educación ella pudo cursar la primaria agradeciendo el esfuerzo y sacrificio por parte de sus padres a pesar de las dificultades y demás en ese entonces. La tierra por la cual agradecen a DIOS por ser propia fue adquirida hace 3 años que gracias a su esposo y sus hijos han podido mantener para sacar el sustento de su familia.
Sus planes y sueños a futuro es poder arreglar su casa de habitación la cual está construida de bajareque por lo que quieren construirla de bloque asegurando la solides de sus cimientos y el bienestar de su familia. Para sus cultivos sus metas son las de poco a poco poder seguir adquiriendo tierras para fortalecerla y dejar de trabajar para otras personas como jornaleros y trabajar al 100% en sus tierras. Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y poder asistir y mantener sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de fertilizantes, limpieza, aplicación de abono entre otros.
texts.en:
María Roselis is a housewife and mother of six children.  The three youngest are studying at a local primary school and the other three are studying at the local high school.  At 41 years of age, María keeps working hard, striving to make a better future for her children.  This is important for her as she was able to complete her primary education thanks to the sacrifices that her parents made, despite all the hardships that they faced when she was young.

Along with her husband, she grows coffee on a small plot of land, which they were able to buy three years ago, after a lot of effort and sacrifice .  They are grateful to God for this plot and thanks to the hard work of her husband and children, they have been able to keep it going and support the family. 

Her plans and dreams for the future are to be able to rebuild her house which is only made of waddle and daub.  They would like to build it out of bricks and support its foundations so that it is safer for the family.  

Regarding agriculture, her aim is to keep acquiring land little by little to strengthen her position.  Then they could stop working for other people as day laborers and work all of the time on their own land.  For this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies.  She wants to be able to care for and maintain her coffee plantations by buying fertilizers, cleaners, manure and other related things.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee plantations

loans.name: José Pastor

texts.es:
José de 51 años, aprendió el oficio de herrador, desde que tenía 20 años  de vida y la adquirió con el tío que se dedicaba a la herrería.  Él se casó y creció a sus cinco hijos (3 varones y 2 hembras) con ese trabajo. Ahora  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, porque los hijos le ayudan a comprar los fertilizantes y le pagan varios trabajadores.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para construir una fosa séptica, pagara mano de obra, y le ganan $18 dólares el día a la vez comprara ladrillo, también una  camionada de piedra, cemento y arena, esto tiene un costo de 1,500 en total. 

Cabe mencionar, que con la fosa tendrá más comodidad la familia, más salud e higiene en la familia, no contaminaran el medio ambiente. 

También podemos hablar de la seguridad, porque, en un cantón para hacer las necesidades del cuerpo se debe salir a fuera.  Sin embargo, construyendo la fosa lo harán dentro de la casa, porque la delincuencia está a la vuelta de la esquina. Esta familia saldrá favorecida con el crédito que se le otorgue.       
 
A futuro le gustaría seguir  trabajado, ya no igual que antes, pero comenta que mientras Dios pida el alma de él, desea ver crecer a sus nietos y tener una vida más cómoda.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. He learned the trade of a blacksmith since he was 20 years old, and he acquired it from his uncle, who worked as a blacksmith. He married and raised his five children (3 boys and 2 girls) with this work.  Now, he works farming corn and beans, because his children help him to buy the fertilizer, and they pay various workers. 

The loan that he is requesting is for building a septic tank and paying for labor, costing him $18 per day; at the same time, he will buy bricks and also a truckload of rocks, cement, and sand; this has a total cost of 1,500.

He says that with the tank, his family will have more comfort and better health and hygiene, and they will not contaminate the environment. 

Security can also be mentioned, because in a canton, in order to take care of “bodily functions”, you have to go outside. However, by building the tank, they can do this inside the house, as crime is just around the corner. This family will be greatly helped out with the loan that they are offered. 

In the future he would like to continue working, just not the same as before; but he says that as long as God asks for his soul, he wishes to see his grandchildren grow and have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to build a septic tank and pay for labor, costing him $18 per day; at the same time, he will buy bricks and also a truckload of rocks, cement, and sand; this has a total cost of 1,500.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy pigs and feed to raise and fatten for four months. She has been in this business before, but due to difficult circumstances, she used her hog-raising capital during her child's delivery in the hospital. Now, if given another chance, she will do hog raising again since she already has her pigpen. 

Zenaida is now 32 years old with three young kids. She is married to a farmer. They work hard for the betterment of their children's future. For Zenaida, she wants to save for the higher education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem (in the photo), age 63, is a widowed mother with six children. Unfortunately, one of her children passed away, one is married and lives separately, one is a garment worker, one attends school and the other two are assisting their mother in the business.
 
Sem sells grocery and meat at home. She does not have a proper shop to store meat and grocery items for sale. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to build a shop.

loans.use: To build a shop to store meat and grocery items for sale.

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring shop in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, needles, thread, etc for her tailoring shop business.

Lovella has been in this business for 30 years and earns more income from food vending.

Lovella has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, nedles, thread, etc

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is a member of this three-person lending group. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is 27 years old, married and a mother of eight children: four daughters and four sons. 

Her husband owns a general store near his house. He sells a variety of daily usage products including sugar, rice, flour etc. Presently, he needs to purchase a variety of products to sell. However, he doesn't have enough savings to purchase these things. Therefore, Tasleem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase sugar, rice, milk powder and ice cream.  

This will help him to continue his business. Tasleem hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's shop. She wishes to provide a quality education to her children. She is thankful for KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, milk powder and ice cream.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Teresita has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sisal, silk, rope, hawser, thead, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Cinthia Mabel

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia Mabel  de 22  años de edad, vive con su esposo,   tiene   dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de un familiar, en una comunidad  de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Cinthia Mabel   se dedica desde hace 04  años  al negocio de la venta de ropa nueva, su venta es de forma ambulante,  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Cinthia Mabel   está solicitando el préstamo para compra de varias docenas de ropa nueva como blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, braseares, etc. para tener mercadería disponible porque para la época navideña se vende bastante este tipo de mercadería. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
Cinthia Mabel  está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es tener buen surtido de ropa, es el cuarto préstamo que solicita.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Cinthia Mabel is a young woman of 22 years. She lives with her husband and two children who depend on her in the house of a relative in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.

Cinthia Mabel has been working for 4 years in the business of selling new clothes. She is a mobile vendor and a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.

Cinthia Mabel is requesting the loan for the purchase of several dozen new clothes like blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, bras, etc. She wants to have merchandize on stock because in the Christmas season these kinds of goods sell very well. With the help of the loan she hopes to improve her income and therefore her quality of life.

Cinthia Mabel is happy to work with Prisma and her wish is to have a good assortment of clothing. This is the fourth loan she is requesting.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, bras, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo gracias al apoyo de Fundación Alternativa ha podido ofrecer variedad de prendas a sus clientes y crecer a nivel laboral. Aunque anteriormente también vendía ropa en otra ciudad, ahora se ha establecido perseverando en su fábrica de ropaa pesar de que hace aproximadamente 10 años le robaron su mercadería asaltando su local  y lo dejó desfinanciado por lo que tuvo que cerrar, pero su sastrería le ayudó a recuperarse poco a poco. Conoció a Fundación Alternativa hace tres años porque escuchó por la radio un anuncio, ahora ya son más de tres créditos y se siente muy agradecido ya que poco a poco ha podido comprar más máquinas y así se le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida. Ahora con este crédito va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres y demás insumos ya que se acerca la temporada de fiesta  donde confecciona más ropa y la demanda por las fechas festivas es bastante alta. Gustavo agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por la confianza depositada en él y en su proyecto de crecimiento.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support of the Fundación Alternativa, Gustavo has been able to offer a variety of clothing to his clients while expanding his business.  Although before he used to sell clothing in another city, he is now making his own clothing.  About ten years ago the merchandise he had was stolen from his shop and he had to close the business for lack of financing.  But opening his tailor shop has helped him recover little by little.

Three years ago he heard about Fundación Alternativa on the radio and since then has had over three loans for which he is very grateful.  Gradually, he has been able to buy more machines and improve his quality of life.  With this loan he will buy fabrics, threads, closures and other supplies for the upcoming holiday season.  The demand for clothing at this time of year is fairly high.  

Gustavo is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the trust shown in him and his expansion plan.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and sewing supplies to make clothing.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is widowed with five children. She is 68 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. Pacita is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional livestock feed and other supplies.

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Jessika Walesca

texts.es:
La joven Jessika  de 25  años de edad, vive con su esposo  tiene  04  hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de un familiar, en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras.
Jessika se dedica desde hace 05  años  al negocio de la venta de ropa nueva y golosinas su venta es de forma ambulante, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Jessika está solicitando el préstamo para compra de materia prima como yuca, chile verde, cebolla, tomates, plátanos verdes, papas para aperturar un negocio de golosinas ya que lo tiene en su casa y desea tener un local mas amplió ya tiene el local para este negocio. 
Jessika con el apoyo de este préstamo espera  mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su deseo es tener buena clientela para sus golosinas, también ella ha vendido ropa pero a dejarlo de hacerlo porque esta recuperando el dinero de crédito.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2013.
texts.en:
Jessika, 25, is a young woman who lives with her husband and four dependant children.  They all live in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.  For five years she has been working as a street vendor selling new clothing and snacks.  She is a hard worker and determined to get ahead.

Jessika is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as yucca plant, green pepper, onion, tomatoes, green bananas and potatoes to open a snack shop.  She now works at home but wants a larger locale to work from, which she has already found.

With the help of the loan she hopes to improve her income and quality of life.  She enjoys working with Prisma and hopes to have a good customer base for her snack business.  She has sold clothing in the past but no longer will be doing so with this new loan.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2013

loans.use: To buy yucca plant, green pepper, onion, tomatoes, green bananas and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Dilia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de rosquilla, desde hace 20 años.
Doña Rosa tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como maíz, soda, harina, huevos, sal, etc. para seguir realizando sus productos, los cuales le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Rosa espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y también espera poder mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Rosa  sus sueño es que en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia en los diferentes problemas económicos que se les presenten.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard-working and responsible person and lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. For 20 years she has had a business selling "rosquillas" [traditional ring-shaped biscuits]. She runs her business from her home in the town where she lives. 

Rosa needs the loan to buy more raw ingredients such as corn, baking soda, flour, eggs, salt etc. so she can carry on making her products, which provide a large part of her income. Rosa hopes that her sales will increase and this loan will help her a lot since she does not have enough ingredients to fulfil her customers' orders. She also hopes to improve her own and her family's quality of life a little with the increase in household income.

Rosa's dream is to grow her business in the short term and so continue to support her family in the various financial difficulties which crop up.

Choluteca, Honduras – October 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, baking soda, flour, eggs, salt etc. for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn Yaneth

texts.es: Evelyn  de 34 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de tres años de edad. Desde hace 10 años se gana la vida como artesana. Hace variedad de comales, ollas y sartenes a base de barro y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Evelyn es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora junto a su compañero de vida llevan la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar el piso del corredor de su casa ya que actualmente es de tierra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena para encementar el piso lo antes posible y evitar que se siga lavando con el agua de las  lluvias.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their little 3-year-old son. For 10 years she has earned a living as an artisan. She makes a range of clay hotplates, pots and frying pans and this is how she earns a living and provides for the household. Evelyn is a very hard-working and enterprising woman and she and her husband contribute jointly to the household income. 

Evelyn wants to improve the floor of the passageway in her home which is currently made of earth. For this reason she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement and sand to put down a concrete floor as soon as possible, to stop it from being continually washed away by the rain.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to lay a concrete floor in her house.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: Mirta de 40 años de edad, reside junto a su grupo familiar conformado por sus hijos quienes son mayores de edad y sus dos pequeños nietos de tres y un años de edad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente todos los días como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo. Mirta no cuenta con energía eléctrica en su casa por lo que solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de  electricidad  en su vivienda y dar a sus hijos y nietos mejores condiciones habitacionales para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mirta, 40, lives with her family which is comprised of her adult children and her two small grandchildren, ages three and one year old.  Family is her priority and the reason she works every day.  For a long time she has worked as a domestic employee.

Mirta does not have electricity at home and is requesting a loan through FUSAI to install the service.  She wants to give her children and grandchildren better living conditions for their development.

loans.use: To install electricity at home.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia  es una mujer admirable ya que a sus  58 años de edad no deja de trabajar y luchar por mejores condiciones de vida. Ofelia es madre soltera y con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo, quien ya es mayor de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comales, sartenes y ollas a base de barro. Este oficio ha sido y sigue siendo su principal fuente de ingresos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para encementar el piso el cual es de tierra, y para hacer una chimenea para evitar que su casa se siga deteriorando por el humo. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con dicho apoyo y poder lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Ofelia is an admirable woman because at 58 years old she has not stopped working and fighting for better living conditions. Ofelia is a single mother who with her work and effort has been able to get her son ahead, who is now and adult. She works making comales, pans and pots from clay. This trade has been and continues to be her main source of income. In order to improve her living conditions, she is asking FUSAI for a loan to cement her floor, which is a now a dirt floor, and to make a chimney to keep her house from deteriorating from smoke. With the loan, she will buy cement, sand and gravel. She hopes to be able to have this support and reach their goal.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel to cement her floor and build a chimney.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José de 36 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 11 años de edad. José trabaja como jornalero en una hacienda de su localidad en la cual hace variedad de actividades como: cuidar y pastear vacas. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y le da a su familia lo necesario. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que el techo se encuentra deteriorado y las paredes que son de adobe se lavan cuando el agua lluvia salpica sobre ella. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina y madera para reparar el techo y para la compra de cemento y arena para repellar las paredes.
texts.en: José is 36 years old. He lives in the house he owns with his life's companion and their two children, aged 5 and 11. José works as a laborer at a farm in his community where he performs a variety of activities such as caring for and grazing cows. In this way, he supports his home and gives his family what it needs. He wants to do some home improvement because the roof is deteriorated and the walls, which are adobe, are covered in water when the rain splashes on them. Because of this, he is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying sheeting and wood to repair the roof and to buy cement and sand to re-plaster the walls.

loans.use: to buy: sheeting and wood to repair the roof and to buy cement and sand to re-plaster the walls.

loans.name: Sonia  Veronica

texts.es:
Sonia vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, ciudad del Ecuador muy conocida por ser  comercial y turística. Sonia es una Señora de 28 años, casada con Stalin un señor de 30 años, tienen  3 hijitos varones de 9,7 y 3 años, los dos niños mayores se encuentran estudiando en una escuela pública que queda cerca de casa, el pequeño aun pasa al cuidado de ella. Su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad como operador de máquinas en un proyecto de una represa, mientras que Sonia cuenta con su pequeño taller de costura al cual dedica todos los días de la semana; aprendió de este oficio siguiendo cursos ya que siempre le llamó la atención y le gustó la costura. 
Ahora tiene dos máquinas y presta sus servicios desde hace 3 años, Sonia cose uniformes deportivos, edredones y vestidos, también hace arreglos de costura, es conocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo. Uno de sus mayores obstáculos ha sido no contar con el capital suficiente para invertir en su negocio y su sueño es tener un local propio y exclusivo para el taller. 
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa a solicitar información y le llamó mucho la atención los servicios que la institución ofrece, como seguro médico y capacitaciones, de inmediato solicitó un crédito con el cual va a invertir en telas porque en esta temporada festiva mucha gente acude a su negocio por ropa de temporada, disfraces, regalos, etc. Sonia está feliz por la atención que le han dado y dice que con esto van a mejorar mucho sus ingresos y con ello comprará otra máquina para ampliar su taller y un día poder cumplir el sueño de adquirir su local propio. 
Sonia agradece a Fundación Alternativa porque gracias a la oportunidad de buscar financiamiento con Kiva, ella podrá hacer realidad sus sueños y dar ese paso de crecimiento que la llevará lejos.
texts.en:
Sonia lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a famous city in Ecuador known for its trade and tourism.  She is 28 and married to Stalin, 30.  They have three sons, ages 9, 7 and 3.  The two eldest attend the public school near their home and the little one stays at home with his mother.  Her husband works as a machine operator on a dam-building project outside the city.  Sonia has a small sewing business and works every day.  She learned the skill  through courses because she always enjoyed sewing and was attracted to it.

She has two machines and has been in business for three years.  Sonia makes sports uniforms, comforters and dresses.  She also does mending and is well-known in her neighborhood for her good work.  One of the main obstacles she is up against is the lack of capital to invest in her business.  Her dream is to have her own sewing shop.

She requested information from Fundación Alternativa and was attracted by the services offered by the institution, such as medical insurance and training.  She requested a loan immediately to invest in fabrics for seasonal clothing.  During the holiday season many people come to her for clothing, costumes, gifts, etc.  

Sonia is happy with the attention she has received and says this will improve her income greatly.  She is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for giving her the opportunity to receive a Kiva loan.  She will be able to turn her dreams into reality and take the next step in her business growth, which will take her far.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Cristian Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven de 23 años, vive con su pareja Mariuxi de 21 quien está embarazada de quien será el primer hijo de esta pareja. Su domicilio queda ubicado en el Recinto Virgen del Cisne. Un recinto muy conocido por la producción de yuca y plátano, zona productiva que es favorecida por el clima cálido húmedo. Ubicado a pocos minutos de la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, el puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones sierra y costa del Ecuador.
 Daniel trabaja como electricista, pero en vista de que estos ingresos no le ayudan a la manutención de su familia, decidió emprender con la venta de mariscos, ahora ya  lleva 3 años vendiendo pescado y camarón en recintos aledaños,  Daniel recorre en el carro de su padre de quien aprendió esta actividad y ahora le dedica al menos dos días a la semana todo el día, principalmente los días de feria en la ciudad. 
Con el pasar del tiempo, Daniel ha adquirido experiencia y muchos clientes fijos por lo cual ahora ha pensado en recorrer otros lugares de la Región Sierra a ofertar sus productos para lo cual necesita un préstamo que lo usará en la compra de una moto para además también vender sus productos en vehículo propio, es por ello que se acercó a Fundación Alternativa, porque vecinos del recinto han sido beneficiados y le recomiendan por los servicios que brindan. 
Daniel espera poder incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias para brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida mucho más ahora que su primer hijo está en camino, pues además Daniel sueña con poder un día comprar su casa propia.
Él está feliz por la ayuda que Fundación Alternativa pudo darle, con este dinero comprará su moto y también marisco para capitalizarse. 
Agradece a cada inversionista de Kiva por creer en él y en su emprendimiento a pesar de no conocerlo.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young man of 23 years. He lives with his partner Mariuxi, 21 years old, who is pregnant with the couple’s first child. Their house is located in the rural community of Virgen del Cisne. This community is well known for the cultivation of manioc and banana. It is a very productive area because it is favored by a warm and humid climate, and it is just a couple of minutes from the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, the commercial hub between the mountains and the coastal regions of Ecuador.

Daniel works as an electrician, but when he realized that this income did not help him to provide for his family, he decided to start selling seafood. He has now been selling fish and shrimp in the neighboring communities for 3 years. Daniel travels there with the car of his father, who taught him this activity. Daniel now spends at least two whole days a week selling seafood, mainly when it is market day in the city.

With the passage of time, Daniel has gained experience and many regular customers, so now he considers travelling to further places in the mountain region to offer his products. For this he needs a loan which he will use to buy a motorbike, so that he will be able to sell his goods from his own vehicle. Therefore he approached Fundación Alternativa - neighbors in his community have benefited from this institution and recommended the services they provide.

He is happy about the help Fundación Alternativa can give him, and with the money he will buy his motorbike and also seafood to sell. He thanks each investor in Kiva for believing in him and in his undertaking even though they do not know him.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and expand his sales activities to other areas.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder pagar la matricula de sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Cristian tengo 22 años de edad, tengo dos hermanos, soy soltero y no tengo hijos; mis padres se dedican a quehaceres doméstico.
Soy estudiante medicina en UCATECI, me he decidido estudiar esta carrera porque me apasiona la ciencia y además me gusta ayudar a las personas. Dentro de las materias que más gustan están: Anatomía, Fisiología y Fisiopatología.
He decidido recurrir a este préstamo porque por medio de el podré terminar mi formación académica de modo que no tendría más opciones para continuar mis estudios en caso de no recibir  el préstamo.  Una vez recibiendo el préstamo mi vida cambiaría ya que no tendría más preocupaciones para terminar mis estudios de tal manera que solo tendría que esforzarme para estudiar.
Mi meta como estudiante en formación es aprender  cada uno de los temas tratado para de esta manera poder optar  por una buena especialidad después de terminar mis estudios.
texts.en:
Cristian is a young medical student who is asking for a loan to pay the registration fees for his course. 

This is his story: "My name is Cristian, I am 22 years old and I am single with no children. My parents work in domestic jobs. I am a student at UCATECI and I have decided on this career because I am passionate about science and I also like to help people. Among the subjects which I like the most are: Anatomy, Physiology and Physiopathology. 

I have decided to resort to taking out this loan as it will enable me to finish my academic training and without it I would not have any option to continue with my studies. If I got the loan my life would change and I would no longer have any worries about completing my studies and would then just have to concentrate on studying. My goal as a student is to learn each of the topics covered so that I can choose a good specialism after finishing my studies."

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for his studies in Medicine.

loans.name: Saul Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Saúl Ernesto es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la compra y venta de ganado, desde hace 8 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos a este.
Don Saúl Ernesto necesita el préstamo para la compra de una picadora de pasto que en este momento está necesitando para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias le son de mucha utilidad en el hogar. 
Don Saúl Ernesto con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que con esta picadora planea tener el suficiente pasto para el ganado y seguir vendiendo ganado de excelente calidad.
Don Saúl Ernesto espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Saúl Ernesto is a person who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in a community in southern Honduras with his family. His business has been buying and selling cattle for 8 years. He does this from his house in the town where he lives and in places nearby. 

Saúl Ernesto needs the loan to buy a grass shredder that he needs right now to keep doing his job. It helps a lot with the earnings which are very useful for his home. With the loan, Saúl Ernesto hopes that his sales will increase and that this will be good for him because with this shredder he plans on having enough grass for the cattle and to keep selling excellent quality cattle.

Saúl Ernesto hopes to grow his business in the short term and be able to keep supporting his family and for his children to have the education they need so that they can have more opportunities in life. 


Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to buy a grass shredder for his business.

loans.name: Awilda Altagracia

texts.es:
Awilda Altagracia es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Mi nombre es Awilda Alltagracia, tengo 21 años de edad y resido en Sabaneta, La vega. Vivo con mi madre, ama de casa y mi padre, agricultor, también con mis dos hermanas y un hermano.
Estudio en UCATECI la carrera de Medicina, cursando el séptimo cuatrimestre. Me gusta esta carrera porque a través de ella puedo servir a la sociedad necesitada. Mis materias favoritas son anatomía y micro biología.
La razón de mi necesidad por préstamo es que no tengo los recursos suficientes para seguir estudiando y en mi zona se requieren muchos médicos que puedan ayudar a los más necesitados.
Mi meta es salir adelante con mi carrera y lograrlo con buenas calificaciones, para que de alguna manera u otra, mis padres puedan sentirse orgullosos de mí, y como dije con anterioridad, ayudar a todos aquellos que me necesiten.
Espero ser agraciada con el préstamo, para poder seguir adelante con mis grandes metas.
texts.en:
Awilda Altagracia is a young medical student who is asking for a loan to pay for her studies. This is her story:

My name is Awilda Altagracia, I am 21 years old and live in Sabaneta, La Vega. I live with my mother who is a housewife and my father who is a farmer, as well as my two sisters and one brother. I am studying medicine at UCATECI and am in the seventh semester. I like this career as I will be able to use it to serve those in need in society. My favourite subjects are anatomy and microbiology. My reason for needing a loan is that I don't have enough money to carry on studying and in my area a lot of doctors are needed to help those most in need. My goal is to be successful in my studies and get good grades so that one way or another my parents will feel proud of me and, as I already mentioned, to help those who need me. I hope to be lucky with the loan so I can continue towards my big goals.

loans.use: to pay the registration fees for her course in Medicine.

loans.name: Yamid

texts.es:
Yamid tiene 25 años y nació en un pequeño municipio llamado Ciénaga, ubicado en el Caribe Colombiano. Es el hijo mayor de tres hermanos, sus padres tienen una droguería y gracias a sus ahorros, Yamid estudió Ingeniería Química en la Universidad del Atlántico ubicando el puesto 2 sobre 26 graduandos. 

Yamid tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en Ingeniería Química en Europa y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma, de conocimiento y  de aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Yamid anhela trabajar como docente investigador contribuyendo en mejorar la oferta de productos de alto valor agregado.

Aquí está su historia:

Desde que estaba en mi último año de universidad tenía claro que estudiar una maestría en ingeniería en el exterior era una de las principales metas dentro de mi proyecto de vida. Siempre he tenido un destacado desempeño académico, pero actualmente no cuento con capacidad económica para costear los exámenes TOEFL, GRE y los demás requisitos para la aplicación a un posgrado.

A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos, debido a su limitada situación económica. Aunque en este momento estoy trabajando como asistente de investigación en un grupo de investigación en Procesos Químicos y Bioquímicos Sostenibles, mi capacidad de ahorro es limitada y reunir el dinero que necesito para realizar el procedimiento de aplicación me tomaría bastante tiempo, lo cual atrasaría mi sueño por lo menos durante un año. En este punto el apoyo de KIVA sería fundamental para poder acelerar mi proceso de admisión en el exterior, aprovechando esos recursos para obtener mi posgrado y por lo tanto, para acelerar mi regreso para el aporte al desarrollo del país.

Mi gran motivación en obtener una admisión en una maestría en una universidad líder en ingeniería química es regresar a Colombia y contribuir en mejorar la oferta de productos de alto valor agregado. Colombia es uno de los grandes generadores de commodities en el mundo, produce y vende grandes cantidades de recursos como carbón, petróleo, níquel, entre otros. Mi objetivo fundamental es poder trabajar en la investigación ingenieril que haga de materias primas, como las anteriores productos, acabados para la industria electrónica, que generen más réditos a la pequeña y mediana industria local favoreciendo así un crecimiento más equitativo. Desde la ingeniería química estoy seguro que puedo aportar para que mi país se convierta en uno de los líderes del campo de los materiales electrónicos, ya que contamos con todos los recursos y las potencialidades para llegar a serlo.

Invertir en el capital humano de una nación indudablemente conducirá a que esta surja ante cualquier situación, esto es lo  que quiero demostrar a través de mi experiencia de vida. Poco a poco, invirtiendo en las gentes que componen una sociedad, esta progresará y saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Yamid, 25, was born in the small district, Ciénaga, on the coast of the Caribbean Sea.  He is the oldest of three children.  His parents have a drug store and with their savings, they paid for Yamid to study Chemical Engineering at the University of Atlantico, where he got the second highest classification out of the 26 graduates.

Yamid’s dream is to go to Europe to do a Masters in Chemical Engineering.  To be able to do this, he needs Kiva’s help, as it is the only way that he can cover the costs of his language exams, entry tests and university fees.  Once he has completed his Masters and returned to Colombia, he would like to work as a lecturer and researcher, helping to improve the range of high value-added products in the market.

Here is his story:

Since my final year at university, it has been clear in my mind that one of my main aims is to go abroad and do a Masters in Engineering.  I have always stood out academically, but right now I haven’t got the funds to do my TOEFL English exam, GRE General Test or meet other requirements to get a place on a postgraduate course.

Although my parents support my goals, they cannot cover such high costs because of their limited financial position.  Although I am working at the moment as a research assistant for a sustainable Chemical and Biochemical Processes research group, I can only save a small amount of money.  To get the money I need to apply for the course would take me a long time, putting back my dream for at least a year.  Kiva can play an essential role here in allowing me to speed up my application process.  With this support I can complete the Masters and be able to return sooner to contribute to the development of this country.

My main motivation for getting a place on a Masters at one of the leading universities in Chemical Engineering is so that I can return to Colombia and contribute to the production of high value-added products.  Colombia is one of the largest producers of commodities in the world, producing and selling great quantities of resources like coal, oil and nickel, among others.  My main aim is to be able to work in engineering research so we can use these raw materials to manufacture products for the electronics industry.  These would generate more profits for the small and medium sized local enterprises favoring a more equitable growth.  As a chemical engineer, I’m convinced that I can contribute to making my country one of the leaders in the field of electronic materials, making use of the potential and the resources that we have at our disposal.

There’s no doubt that investing in human capital can help a nation overcome any situation, a point I would like to prove through my own life experience.  Little by little, by investing in the people who make up society, we can help it progress and move forward.

loans.use: to pay expenses so he can apply for a Masters in Chemical Engineering

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal for her charcoal sales business.

Mercy has been in this business for 15 years.  Mercy earns more income from raising pigs.  Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rizalyn

texts.en:
Rizalyn is engaged in a hog-raising business.  She has one hog breeder and usually has two fattening pigs for sale.  She is earning PHP 3,000 per fattening pigs when sold while she offers her baby pigs for only PHP 1,800 in wholesale price.  She is happy doing the business and admitted that having this business is a great help to her family.  However, due to financial difficulty, she is requesting for a loan of PH P8,000 as added capital to buy enough feed for the pigs growth and maintenance. 

On the other hand, Rizalyn's husband manages a motorcycle transport as part of their daily income source. They have one child who is now already attending school.  They live in the town of Sto. Tomas.  Rizalyn is hoping to save some of her generated incomes from hog-raising for the improvement of their house.

loans.use: to buy enough feed for the pigs growth and maintenance.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa is 46 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Narcefa is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Narcefa has been farming vegetables for 1 year and also earns additional income from her general store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Basilides

texts.en:
Basilides works hard to support her family.  Basilides is married and has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines.

Basilides requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Basilides has been in this business for 18 years now.  In the future, Basilides would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old and married with two children. 

Teresita is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.  Teresita has been buying and selling livestock for 29 years now and has borrowed 28 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Nida has been in this business for 25 years.  Nida earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.  Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Gonzaga

texts.en:
Gonzaga is a 40 year old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  He deals in cattle trade and also has a butcher shop to enable him to earn a living.  A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and also to set sustainable income generating activities to support his children.  

The high cost of cattle and unpredictable weather changes affect his profits while his dream is to own a ranch.  Gonzaga intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Elmin

texts.en:
Elmin is 30 years old, married and the father of 4 month old baby.  He works with livestock and his wife is a homemaker.  He has worked with livestock for nine years, raising and fattening the animals he buys to later sell them and also sell milk products.  Elmin learned the work from his father and he says that he decided to work in this area because he could not find another way to support his family.  He also works in the local market as a seller for a salary.

Elmin is requesting this loan to buy cows.  He says that milk produce will let him to improve his family’s diet.  Elmin says that his dream is to see his children study and choose a field that will let them have a good life.  He also dreams of selling dairy products in his community in order to improve his income and help his family to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase cows to start milk production.

loans.name: Safia Group

texts.en:
Safia is a 38 year old married women with 4 children and a resident of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a member of a 2-person lending group and requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for her tailoring school.  She is running a tailoring school to help poor families.  She has been doing this for 3 years. S

She always fulfills her job delicately, efficiently and tries to provide the best work environment for her students.  With the loan proceeds, she will  purchase more stitching machines to offer more chances of learning tailoring to poor families.  She said her clients are very pleased with her services. 
Safia personal goals are to make poor families strong.  She is hopeful that the loan will bring a considerable growth to her school.

loans.use: To buy stitching machines.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is taking a loan of $ 1,200 to improve her business.  She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as oils, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, fish, fanta, coca cola, sagiko and sprite.  She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: To buy oils, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, fish, fanta, coca cola, sagiko and sprite to restock the store.

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At (in the photo), age 36, lives across the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City, and has four children. One is a gardener, another is a construction worker, and other two attend school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Sam At stays at home and does house work. The main source of income is from her children's and husband’s businesses. She is asking for a loan to buy a boat and boat motor for her son to supplement the fishing business he has, in addition to construction work.

loans.use: To buy a boat and boat motor for her son.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam (in the photo) is 37 years old. He lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has two children who are in school. 

Sam and his wife have been in the farming business for almost one year. He grows mushrooms. He hopes to expand his mushroom farm; hence, he decided to apply for a loan. He will use the loan to buy seed and materials needed in the business.

loans.use: To expand his mushroom farm through buying seed and materials needed in the business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 36 year old married man with four children living in Kamwenge Uganda.  He owns a bar which he started 3 years ago with the aim of being able to cater for his family needs.  Despite being in business for three years,Paul is faced with a challenge of seasonal customers.  

However, his dream is to expand his bar into a re-known bar in Kamwenge town and to also open up branches in the nearby towns.
Paul intends to use the loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives in Kitale,where there is a high maize production.  She is a devoted farmer, who has done this work for 20 years.  She has a farm where she grows crops and rears poultry,and dairy cows.  Kitale is a very fertile area where farming is taken very seriously by the residents there and so lilke many farmers, Esther derives her income from the sale of; milk, eggs and crops.

Despite the challenge of crop pests and diseases, she enjoys the returns she derives from her farm output.  Esther chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have easy terms of repayment and a low interest rate.  When asked how this loan would benefit her, she said she would purchase poultry which will produce more eggs and thus more income and this will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: For purchasing poultry

loans.name: Prosper

texts.en:
Prosper is a 31 year old married man with four children living in Kamwenge,Uganda.  He is a builder by profession, which is where he got the capital to start up a bar and hotel. As the sole bread winner, Prosper started this business to cater to his family's needs and to pay school fees for his children.

He faces a challenge of price fluctuations for food and also seasonal customers.  His dream is to expand his hotel into a modern bar and restaurant in this town.  Prosper intends to use the loan to buy beer and food for the hotel.

loans.use: to buy beer and food for the hotel.

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en:
Chhon (in the photo) is a widow with 3 children, 1 son and 2 daughters.  Her son is married and lives separately from home and both daughters are garment workers.  

Chhon is a weaver for almost twenty years because it’s a traditional profession.  She is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her son, who is married so that he can drive to work.  Because he does not have his own transportation, he needs to spend lots of money to take motor taxis.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Sime

texts.en:
Sime, age 25, is a vegetable seller.  She has been married since 2006 and has one son who is in school.  She lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver. 

Sime is requesting a loan to build a fence around her house and to pay for building fees.
   
Photo: Sime and her husband.

loans.use: To build a fence around her house and pay for building fees.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora works hard to support her family.  Teodora is married and has a rice sales business in the Philippines.  Teodora requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Teodora has been in this business for 5 years now and also earns additional income from farming rice.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Teodora would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 30 years old. She is single. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito is a 55 year old married man with six children living in Kamwenge,Uganda.  He owns a stall where he sells fish and other perishables.  He has been in this business since 1990.  His aim in starting this business was to get more income to sustain his family, pay school fees for his children and buy land. 

Although Expedito is still in this business, he faces a challenge of weather changes that affects the perishable products and also the continuous price fluctuation of agricultural products.  His dream is to relocate to the town and transform his business into a big grocery in Kamwenge town.

Expedito is requesting for a loan to buy fish and other food stuffs to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Mactar

texts.fr: Monsieur Mactar est un homme âgé de 36 ans il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la vente de pièces détachées depuis plus de 5 ans. Mactar sollicite ce montant pour acheter des pièces détachées pour ensuite les revendre à ses clients. Il est responsable des charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. A l’avenir il souhaite augmenter son stock de marchandises ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mactar is 36 years old, married, and the father of a family. He has been in the business of selling spare parts for more than 5 years. He is requesting this loan to purchase spare parts for resale to his customers. He is responsible for the daily needs of supporting his family and the schooling costs for his children. In the future, he hopes to increase his stock of merchandise in order to increase his revenues and to improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old, married, and has six children.  She lives in Lenienza, Pagadian City. Victoria sells bananas, rice cakes, and other snacks, which she has been doing for almost one year. 

Victoria is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients for her food business. She has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Victoria hopes to expand her little business into a bigger one.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Natercia

texts.en:
Natercia is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $ 1.000 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $ 100.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as shirts, pants, women's clothes, men's clothes, and boy's pants.  She is a very hard working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years.  She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, women's clothes, men's clothes, and boy's pants

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family.  Luzviminda operates a fishing business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  

Luzviminda is requesting her thirteenth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy materials, such as wood and bamboo, for the maintenance of her fishing boat. She hopes that her hard work will help her to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Oumou Koussoum

texts.fr: Oumou est une femme qui est à sa 37ème année. Elle est mariée et mère d’un seul enfant  qui est agé de 14ans. Oumou est une commerçante de tissus et de prêt à porter qu’elle vend dans son magasin sis dans un marché de la commune. Elle demande ce crédit d’un mon tant de 150.000F pour augmenter son stock de marchandise et diversifier son activité. Elle commence sa journée  à 9h et la termine à 14h. Oumou souhaite la pérennisation pour ne plus avoir besoin de l’aide des crédits et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Oumou is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of a single child who is 14 years old. She sells fabric and ready to wear clothing in a shop as well as in a local market. Oumou is requesting this loan of 150,000 francs CFA to increase her stock of merchandise and to diversify her business. She begins her day at 9am and works until 2pm. She hopes to become self-sustaining so she no longer needs the help of loans, and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing and fabric for resale

loans.name: Nalen

texts.en:
Nalen is 34 years old, married, and has one child. She lives across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a construction worker.  

Nalen is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy weaving material.

loans.use: to purchase weaving material.

loans.name: Anastazi

texts.en:
Anastazi is 46 years old and has six children. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming he hopes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supports labor costs

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 41. He is a father of one child, age 11. His wife works as a farmer and they've been helping each other in their farming. 

He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 32-year-old hardworking housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, one daughter and five sons. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years, he also drives a taxi at night. 

Currently, he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Because of short of funds, Asma requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to meet the amount of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profit, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in future. 

Asma desires to provide quality education to her all children and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very much thankful to BRAC.

loans.use: To pay to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora works hard to support her family. Nora is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 45 years old. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs  fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and support labor costs

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Voeun is married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  He lives in a village about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. He is a motor taxi driver and his wife is a garment worker.

Voeun is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase a new motor because the old one is breaking down. In the photo are Voeun and his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for his motorcycle

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a 29-year-old hardworking married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a butcher shop and has been business since 2007. He has "seasonal customers" where meat is mainly bought on weekends and festive days and this poses a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to more butcher shops in other town centers. Dennis intends to use the loan to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats to slaughter and sell.

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir, a 50-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband, three sons, and four daughters. One son and two daughters are studying, and her husband is an auto mechanic. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Munir is trying to help him by stitching clothes. She is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Munir has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To pay for a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sor Phorn

texts.en:
Sor Phorn (in the photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is a widow with one son and two daughters.

Sor Phorn has been weaving for almost 27 years because it’s a main traditional profession. She is asking for a loan to replace her old motorbike. The old motorbike is breaking down and uses more gasoline than a new one. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials.

loans.use: To replace her old motorbike and buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Soeun (in the photo) is a 50-year-old garment worker and her husband is a farmer. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has five children, including three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are garment workers and the other two are lathe operators and another one is still young. 

Soeun is asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. Because he does not have his own transportation, he commutes with his neighbors often.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La joven Alma es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es una Pulpería, desde hace 10 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Doña Alma necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, queso, churros, agua, refrescos, azúcar, galletas, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes.
Doña Alma con esta ayuda espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Su sueño es en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y sus hijos tengan los estudios para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
