Alma's a very hardworking and responsible young person.  She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras.  For 10 years her business has been a grocery store in her house in the town where she lives.

Alma needs the loan to buy more products such as rice, beans, corn, cheese, chips, water, soda, sugar, cookies, and so forth.  This way she can continue doing her job, which gives her a big part of her income.

Alma doesn't have the products she needs to fill her customers' requests, so she hopes the loan will help her to increase her sales. She'll be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in her household income.

Her short-term dream is to grow her business.  This way she can continue supporting her family and giving her children an education so they'll have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, October 2013

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a married woman with four children, some of whom are in school. Farming is her major source of income. She cultivates rice and cassavas on her own land and sells them into the markets every harvest season. She has been in the business for almost 10 years in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province.

Chan has applied for a loan of 500 US dollars to drill a well in her yard and install a hand pump on the top of the drilled well. With a well, Chan is hoping that she won’t face water shortage for the household and she won't need to spend much time to collect water from the far distant areas any more. She thanks Kiva lenders for a show interest in a poor person like her.

loans.use: to drill a well and install a hand pump on the top.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene is 41 years old. He is married with five children, and they all go to school. He would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 66 years old, widowed, and has 10 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Luzminda buys and sells tobacco in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 21 years.

Luzminda is requesting a loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of tobacco to sell. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tobacco

loans.name: Fordard

texts.en:
Fordard is aged 55. He is married with five children. He has been a maize farmer for the past twenty years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer in order to increase maize production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 34 years old and lives in Vanadzor, which is in the Lori region. Lilit graduated from the Yerevan State University in the department of geography and geology. Now she works at the school as a deputy director and she is also a schoolmaster for geography. 

Her pupils like her very much since she is a very clever and kind person who works with children with great pleasure and care. She is respected very much, both by her pupils and by the staff of the school where she works. 

Lilit is married and she has two children. Her husband works as a police officer.

Lilit is asking for a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy a computer and some literature connected with her subject and also maps, which she needs during her lessons.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature connected with her subject and also maps, which she needs during her lessons.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 32-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a produce store that he started in 2009. He has progressed, even though he faces challenges of seasonal changes, especially drought, in Kamwenge. 

As the head of the family, he has a dream of educating his children to higher levels of learning and also to expand his store into a standardized one in the district.

Innocent intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize, groundnuts and cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize, groundnuts and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy animal feed and seed for sowing.

loans.name: Sovanny

texts.en:
Sovanny (pictured here), age 24, is a cleaner for Maxima, one of Kiva's partners in Cambodia. Sovanny lives with her widow mother, brothers and sister in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

In addition, she also raises pig at home. She asks for a loan to buy pig feed.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Dominique

texts.en:
Dominique is 63 years old. He is married to a farmer and they have seven children. He would like to use this Kiva loan to pay for his labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors, which will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay the labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. Ana is married and has a buying and selling of shells business in the Philippines.

Ana requested a 10,000 PHP [Philippine pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional shells to sell.

Ana has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells to sell.

loans.name: Try

texts.en:
Try (in the photo), age 50, is a construction worker. He lives in a suburb of Phnom Pen. He has three children; one son is in school and two children are garment workers. His wife stays at home and does housework.

Try is asking for a loan to expand the house where he lives by putting in front porches.

loans.use: To expand the house where he lives by putting in front porches.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 46 years old and lives in Bliss Culo Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is widowed with five children.

Lerma has a livelihood business in "lampakanay" (native dry goods -- a fiber extracted from the lampakanay plant is a common material for bags and baskets. Ropes and twisted lampakanay are used for the production of chairs, armchairs, sofas and other occasional furniture.) She earns approximately 6,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase raw materials for her "lampakanay" business. 

Lerma has been a member of PMPC for six months. In the future, Lerma hopes to improve her business and wants to engage in more businesses someday.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her "lampakanay" business.

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en:
Kahramon is a hardworking man. He is a student of the first course. He studies at the Agriculture University of Tajikistan. Kahramon wants to work at a collective farm and to develop farming systems in Tajikistan. He studies hard and often goes to the library. He has a hobby of listening to classic Tajik music. 

Kahramon is not married and lives with his parents. Kahramon is asking for a loan of $400 to pay for tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition at the university.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen (in the photo), age 33, is a construction worker. He has been married since 2000, and has two young sons. His wife is a garment worker. 

Besides construction works, Pen also raises cows at home. 

He is asking for a loan to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov (in the photo), age 25, lives across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2011, and just has one young son. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Sreypov is appling for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 53 years old. She would like to use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Flugence

texts.en:
Flugence, a 43-year-old married father of five, would like to use this  Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers to increase his maize production. He wishes to reinvest his profits into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production

loans.name: Ithungu

texts.en:
Ithungu is a 36-year-old married woman with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She is a farmer who mainly grows maize, but also runs a bar since farming is seasonal. Unpredictable weather and inadequate capital affect her business growth, while her desire is to venture into mechanized agriculture.

Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University.

Ithungu is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and also to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, and also to pay for labor.

loans.name: Manasse

texts.en:
Manasse, a 63-year-old married father of six, would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers to increase his maize production. He wishes to reinvest profits into his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Seng Kun

texts.en:
Sengkun (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four children--three sons and one daughter. 

Sengkun is asking for a loan to replace her old motorbike. The old motorbike is breaking down and uses more gasoline than a new one. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials.

loans.use: To replace her old motorbike and buy weaving materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 33 years old. She is a mother of three. Her husband works in a public institution and has been in the business for the past two years. She would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from farming, she wishes to invest in the business so that in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance the farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Rosanela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosanela works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosanela is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Rosanela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, spices, etc

loans.name: Ma. Elva

texts.en:
Ma. Elva is 44 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Elva is borrowing 25,000 PHP [Philippine pesos] through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Elva has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Christina

texts.en:
Ma. Christina is 41 years old and is a widowed mother of two children.

Ma. Christina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soap, soft drinks, sardines and school supplies.

Ma. Christina has borrowed and repaid eleven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Ma. Christina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, soft drinks, sardines and school supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 57 years old. He is married with six children. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production; he needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, baking soda, salt, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Asiel

texts.en:
Asiel is 46 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is requesting for a loan to renovate his rental houses. He is a hardworking married man living in Hoima, Uganda. He has rental houses where he earns a monthly income and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Tenants not paying on time and also being negligent with his property impact his monthly incomes.  Moses's desire is to own a housing estate and also diversify into agriculture.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, a 53-year-old married mother of nine children, two of whom are still in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fe has a native bag-making business in the Philippines, one that she has operated for five years. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam works hard to support her family. Meriam is married, and she has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Meriam has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc., for her business.

Meriam has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, bamboo sticks, etc., for her business

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family. Genalyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Genalyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net.

Genalyn has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Zhasmin

texts.en:
Zhasmin is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia, department of Sociology. Here is her story:

“It is well known that one should study at the best university to get a high qualified education for the future. I think AUCA is the best university not only in Kyrgyzstan, but also in the whole Central Asia. AUCA has different departments: Anthropology, Business Administration, ICP, etc., but I wanted to study in the Sociology department. AUCA has high qualified teachers, who can convey their thoughts to students, it is very important. Another reason I like the university for is the spirit, which is very friendly and cozy. I already understand and feel my future job and I am ready for it. As a sociologist I will have skills in various fields. I also want to take part in different social events in improving the social status of our country. In future I would like to help people in need. 
Another reason many students apply to AUCA is that it gives financial aid to all of them. I would like to take an opportunity and apply for Kiva loan, which will help me to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Santo Argenis

texts.es:
Santo Argenis es un joven estudiante de Medicina, él está solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia:Hola mi nombre es Santo Argenis, tengo 18 años de edad y vivo con mi padre y mi madre en una humilde casa en Navarrete municipio de Santiago, donde vivo con mis 6 hermanos.
Estudio medicina por que me encanta esa carrera es mi favorita y a demás quiero ayudar a personas necesitadas, estudio en la Utesa-Santiago ya que es una de las universidades que mejor ofrece esa carrera de medicina.
Estoy solicitando el préstamo porque de no recibirlo no podría estudiar sin el. Mi familia es de muy pocos recursos; mi padre trabaja vendiendo verduras en un motor y con ese sustento es que nos mantiene, por lo que mi necesidad es enorme, mis deseos de superarme mucho más y por esto recurro a ustedes.
Mi meta es estudiar para poder ser un gran medico y mi sueño es graduarme para así poder cumplir mi promesa de ayudarle a mi familia a echar para adelante, porque ellos tienen una esperanza en mí. Seria de gran orgullo para mis padres que con tantas limitaciones económicas, pero con los valores que me han dado y la ayuda de Fundapec-Kiva yo sea gran profesional y ejemplo para la sociedad Dominicana y del mundo.
texts.en:
Santo Argenis is a young medical student who's requesting a loan to be able to pay for his studies.  This is his story:

Hello, my name is Santo Argenis.  I'm 18 years old and I live with my father and mother in a modest house in Navarrete, in the municipality of Santiago, with my six siblings.

I'm studying medicine because I love this field; it's my favorite.  Besides, I want to help needy people.  I study at UTESA-Santiago because it's one of the best universities for studying medicine.

I'm requesting the loan because I wouldn't be able to study without it.  My family has limited resources.  My father sells vegetables in a vehicle and supports us with this job.  My need is great and my desire for self-improvement even greater, so I'm appealing to you.

My goal is to study to be a great doctor.  I dream of graduating so I can fulfill my promise to help my family get ahead, because they have hope in me.  It would make my parents so proud that, despite their many financial limitations, with the values they've instilled in me and the help of FUNDAPEC-Kiva I'll be a great professional and an example for Dominican society and the world.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition, transportation, and books

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en:
Sophon is 30 years old and married, the mother of four children. Sophon just finished her education at primary school level, so she described herself as a low-education person who has been engaged in farming as a business. 

She is very hard-working and honest with her daily farming chores, like care-preparing the ground, planting, water balancing, weeding, and harvesting. Her spouse also works growing rice and soybeans alongside her.

The loan she’s asking is to pay for threshing service to harvest her soybeans, which she will sell into the markets for a profit. Her plan is to continue working with the funds to continue to enlarge the area she works, and thereby increase her production. 

She also intends to see that all her children have further education and become professionals in the future. She thanks lenders for their generosities towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to pay for threshing service for harvesting her soybeans.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 54 years old. He is a father of four children. He would like to use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 48 years old and she lives in Sevan city which is in Gegharkunik region. She is married and she has a son and a daughter. They are already married and they live separately from their parents. Gohar’s husband works as a teacher of physics at the nearby village school. Gohar has a specialty of hydrologist and at this moment, being very professional and a skilled specialist, she works at the Sevan city Meteorological Center as a technician. 

Since in their family both of them work, they have managed to put aside some savings in order to furnish their house, but still those savings are not enough. Gohar is asking for a loan of 200,000 Armenian drams in order to buy furniture for their kitchen and living room.

loans.use: to buy furniture for their kitchen and living room

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 42 years old, married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leny has a bakery business in the Philippines. Leny requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, salt, yeast, sugar, etc. for her bread production business.

Leny has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, salt, yeast, sugar, etc. for her bread production business

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 34-year-old married man with two children aged six and one, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling phones and cell phone accessories and the business is very lucrative. Inadequate capital and price fluctuation affect his business growth while his desire is to become a leading distributor of a telecom company. Samuel intends to use the loan to buy phones to sell.

loans.use: to buy phones to sell.

loans.name: Halimata

texts.fr: Madame Halimata est une femme âgée de 40 ans qui est marié et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans l’embouche depuis plus de 3ans. Halimata a besoin de ce crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter du bétail et ensuite les revendre. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. Elle commence sa journée à 8 pour la terminer à 19h. Elle souhaite augmenter son cheptel et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en: Mrs. Halimata is a 40 year old woman who is married with children. She has been working in livestock fattening for over three years. Halimata needs a loan of 100.000F to purchase livestock and then resell them. She helps her husband to manage the family expenses. She starts her working day at 0800 and finishes at 1900. She hopes to increase her flock and satisfy her customers.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats for resale.

loans.name: Jenely

texts.en:
Jenely is 35 years old and has five children. Jenely is married and all five children are in school.

Jenely is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jenely requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Jenely has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jenely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 41 years old. She is a mother of eight children. She would like to use a Kiva loan to support labor costs and to buy fertilizer during maize production. She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her production. With the profits from her farming, Marie Rose wishes to invest in her business, so that, in the future, she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi used the previous loan to buy dryers and weaves to sell. She is a 25-year-old, enterprising single mother living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her dream is to build a permanent house, as she is currently living in a semi-permanent dwelling. 

For four years she has been operating a beauty salon. She started as an employee but now has her own business and her ambition is to turn it into a beauty parlor of great renown. One of the challenges she faces is that she has limited capital to meet the high demand. Tausi intends to use the loan to buy oils and braids (hair extensions)  for her salon.

loans.use: to buy oils and hair extensions for her salon.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in agriculture but also trades in a produce business in order to earn income for his family.Good and responsible father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university. Price fluctuation and high cost of transport affect his business growth while his desire is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round. Alex intends to use the loan to buy beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce appreciates for her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. Apart from the gravel selling business, she operates a charcoal selling business. She is requesting a loan of Ksh.20,000 to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pedro Adolfo

texts.es:
Pedro, con el fin de seguir mejorando el servicio que da a sus clientes en la pupusería que tiene; solicita capital para comprar maíz, aceite, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, repollo y otros, que le sirven para tener la materia prima necesaria y seguir trabajando sin limitantes.
 Con el préstamo anterior mejoro el servicio, amplio el negocio, su situación económica ha mejorado, saldo deudas y da a su familia mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro wants to continue improving the service he provides to his customers at his “pupusa” (a tortilla stuffed with various fillings) stall.  Therefore, he is requesting capital in order to buy corn, oil, beans, cheese, pork, cabbage, and other supplies.  These are the items that he needs to continue working without any limitations.  

With his previous loan, Pedro was able to improve his service and expand his business.  As a result, he was able to improve his financial situation, settle his debts, and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, beans, cheese, pork, cabbage, and other supplies.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a widowed woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Loice operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000 to purchase charcoal for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, su principal siembra es el pepino, comercializa sus cultivos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa de propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los hermanos que tiene le ayudan a trabajar en la agricultura, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y así poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
This borrower has been a farmer for two years.  Cucumbers are his main crop and he sells them at the markets that are near his home.  With the profit he generates from his sales, he is able to help with the family expenses.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their three children.  His siblings help with the farm work.  

The borrower is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies that he needs for planting his crops such as compost, seeds, and fertilizers.  This will result in better earnings, which would allow him to continue helping with the household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is employed as a paid laborer in Korea, while the other is attending to school. Pheng and her spouse help each other in farming activities in order to put the family in better living conditions. 

Pheng has been engaged in this field for almost 15 years.  She owns three small pieces of farmland, which are not too far from her house. She primarily grows rice once a year, and she earns a net profit of $2 per day. Through hardships she has, Pheng is confident to overcome challenges and improve her standard of living.

At the moment, Pheng would like to order a set of solar home system to install at her home. This will allow her family members to gain access to clean energy, helping them with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. 

Due to the shortage of funds, she has requested a loan amounting to USD 550  to buy a set of solar home system. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. 

She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a set of solar home system.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a 'buy and sell' livestock business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business. She has been in this business for seven years now.

Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Belina

texts.en:
Belina is 62 years old and she lives in the village of Khashtarak, which is in Ijevan region. She is a widow. She has four children. Her three daughters are married and they live with their families. Her son is also married (he has three children) and he lives with her. 

For many years, Belina has worked at the tobacco plants, the leaves of which she has gathered and sorted. Now, she works at the Ijevan city Mineral Water factory, as a worker. 

Belina is also engaged in farming, in which her son helps her very much. On her farm, Belina has 20 chickens and two pigs which are going to have piglets. She also has some plans to increase the number of her farm cattle.

Belina asks for a loan of AMD 1,100,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy three calves and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy three calves and a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 27 years old, a young and talented man. He lives with his family in Kapan city in Syunik region. He graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute, Faculty of Fine Arts. He has done distance learning and after graduating till today he has worked at the Kapan city Fine Arts School as a painting teacher. He is a very interesting and artistic person, who perfectly paints landscapes and portraits. 

Edgar lives with his father, who works as a locksmith; his mother is a cook and his grandmother is retired and receives a pension. Edgar has met a very nice and lovely girl and they have decided to get married. He is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to organize his wedding party properly.

loans.use: to organize his wedding party properly

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu is 30 years old and married with two children. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present her business is sometimes difficult because purchasing power is very low.

Memunatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justine is a 31-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells fresh foods like tomatoes and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. High rate of perishability  and weather changes affect her since she operates from the open in different markets. Her dreams are to build a permanent house, set up a food store with preservation equipment, and expand her business to other markets. Justine intends to use the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 36 years old and lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. She has a higher education and works at a private big mobile connection company as a leading specialist. Syuzanna lives with her mother in a cute flat. Recently, Syuzann’s father died which was a great loss for their family. She is the only child and this was a shock for her. Syuzanna cannot overcome her grief and feels very upset and unhappy.

Syuzanna is requesting an 800,000 AMD loan to buy and place a tombstone at her father’s grave in the cemetery.

loans.use: to buy and place a tombstone at her father’s grave in the cemetery

loans.name: Davliatbegim

texts.en:
My name is Davlatbegim. I graduated from the Aga Khan School of Osh this year and entered the American University of Central Asia, Department of Psychology. 

I have studied all the subjects in the  English language during the past seven years at the Aga Khan School. Another reason is that AUCA is famous for unconventional methods of education, and there is no corruption, which is very important for me. 

AUCA is a university that gives a person great opportunities in the future. But the tuition fees are unaffordable for my family, because only one member of my family is employed. 

It would be very difficult for me to focus on studying if I know that my family has to think on where to find money for my studies. Apart from that, I have two more sisters, and my older sister is studying at the faculty of Medicine of the State University in Osh. 

My mother pays for her, too, so I need a KIVA loan to cover at least part of my tuition fees.

loans.use: To help pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 48 años, está casada con Guillermo y tiene 1 hijo de 12 años. Vive en una casa hecha de madera que construyó junto a su pareja. Es propietaria junto a su pareja de un terreno cerca de su comunidad donde se dedica hace mas de 20 años a la producción de cacao, palillo y achiote. Al iniciarse tuvo la suerte de recibir apoyo económico de sus padres para la compra de su terreno así como de sus suegros que le facilitaron percibir sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque puede realizar tareas cotidianas para al correcto mantenimiento de sus plantaciones como son el retiro de maleza que crece constantemente  y el uso de abonos orgánicos para obtener mejores cosechas. En varias ocasiones contrata a trabajadores del lugar para que la apoyen en sus tareas y en la cosecha ya que considera que es complicado trasladar sus productos en pesados sacos hasta las carreteras para llevarlos hasta los centros de acopio. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para invertir en sus terrenos con la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Clara is 48 years old. She is married to Guillermo and they have a 12-year-old son. She lives in a wooden house that she built with her husband. She and her husband own land near their community on which they have grown cacao, turmeric, and annatto. In the beginning, she was lucky to have the support of her parents and her in-laws to purchase the land, which allowed her and her husband to use their income to support their family.

She likes her job because she can do daily tasks to maintain the crops correctly, like remove the weeds that grow constantly and use organic fertilizers to obtain better harvests. Many times, she hires local workers to help with these tasks and to harvest, since it is very complicated to transport the products in heavy sacks to the highways to take them to the storage locations.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move forward. She also promises to make her payments on time. This time, she hopes to receive 1,000 nuevos soles to invest in her land by purchasing organic fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatimata Amadou

texts.fr: Fatimata est une brave femme qui a 48ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille dont le plus âgée a 30ans et le plus petit 10ans. Elle évolue dans la vente de poisson frais. Elle a une expérience  de plus de 10ans dans son activité. Fatimata a besoin de ce montant pour acheter des poissons frais et ensuite les revendre à ses clients. Elle commence sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 14h. Fatimata aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Elle souhaite à l’venir ouvrir une ferme d’élevage et augmenter ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en: Fatimata is a good woman of 48. She is married with children of whom the oldest is aged 30 and the youngest 10. She sells fresh fish. She has over 10 years' experience in this business. Fatimata needs this loan to buy fresh fish that she will then sell to her clients. She starts her working day at 0900 and finishes at 1400. Fatimata helps her husband to manage the daily family expenses. In the future she hopes to open a fish farm and increase her income in order to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Salamata

texts.fr: Salamata est une femme qui est agée de 33ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commerce de prêt à porter. Elle a une expérience de plus de 8ans dans son activité. Salamata sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000F pour acheter des prêts à porter et ensuite les revendre au marché. Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 14h car étant mère de famille elle prépare toujours le repas de midi pour ses enfants et fait le ménage. Elle souhaite à l’avenir ouvrir une grande boutique pour pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Salamata is 33 years old, married, and the mother of a family. She is in the business of selling ready-to-wear clothing, which she has been doing for more than 8 years. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA in order to purchase ready-to-wear clothing for resale at the market.

Salamata begins her day at 8am and works until 2pm since she is the mother of a family and always prepares the mid-day meal for her children and takes care of the household. She hopes in the future to open a large shop to be able to increase her revenue and to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ready to wear closing for resale to her customers

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un is married and a loving mother of seven children. She lives with her family in a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income and she has been in this business for nearly 15 years. Her husband and her children help her to maintain their rice field. With the current business, she is able to earn a net profit KHR 20,000 per day.

This is the fourth micro-loan for Un with HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner. She would like to acquire a loan of KHR 2,000,000, which she will use to buy two cows for the maintenance of the rice fields. She hopes to continue working with the funds and improving her current business. She thanks lenders for their generosity towards less fortunate people like her.

loans.use: to buy two cows for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is 24 years old. She lives in Sevan city, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Armine lives with her parents and her brother temporarily lives abroad. Her mother does not work since she is handicapped and her father is an engineer. Armine has a higher education and she is a chemist who works at a chemical laboratory as a junior research fellow. 

Armine has recently had some health problems and is requesting a 450,000 AMD loan to use for her teeth treatment.

loans.use: to treat her teeth

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu from Tombo western rural in Sierra Leone. She is in her late-30s, married with three children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2009, Kadiatu established her home product business. She began her business because she wanted to get source of income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes, purchasing power of customers is very low.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her standard of living. In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cups, food containers, and plates for resale.

loans.name: Tolgonai

texts.en:
My name is Tolgonai. I graduated high school this year and enrolled in the American University of Central Asia. 

Investment is what drives economy – as an individual; my personal investments are in my education. I started school when I was five, without finishing kindergarten. All my life I have been a good student, participated in Olympiads and in school activities. Last year I was lucky to get a scholarship for an exchange year in America. 

High school might sometimes be boring, so in order to keep a balance between academics and entertainment, I have been looking for extracurricular activities after classes. I was involved in volunteering and students council. There was an organization where all school leaders participated. It concentrated on public health, environment protection, and local development. I enjoyed organizing all kinds of workshops for school students about health and teenage issues over three years. We also had summer camps. The most exciting project was raising money for local park recreation. 

I was also involved in Student Council as a Minister of Culture and was responsible for every cultural event that took place at school and I got a lot of skills. All the above mentioned will give me a good opportunity to be an active part of social life at the American University of Central Asia. 

Unfortunately my parents can’t afford full tuition at AUCA. My family is pretty big; it consists of six people. So I need a KIVA loan, because it will help me to think about education, to study well and not to think about finance.

loans.use: To pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Ana Eduviges

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 57 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Hace 15 años que se dedica a la venta de mercadería, productos como ser ropa jeans, faldas, short, blusas, camisas, también arreglos florales, espejos, retrateras, maquillaje, adornos etc. El prestamo que solicita es por 25,000 Lempiras siendo este el quinto ciclo de préstamo con la institución, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de mas mercadería como flores, retrateras, adornos, maquillajes y ropa para su negocio y que las ventas y ganancias aumenten.  Su meta es seguir creciendo como persona, ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Doña Ana is 57 years old and a single mother of two children.  She resides in the town of Gracias Lempira.

She has been selling merchandise for 15 years.  These products include clothing such as jeans, skirts, shorts, and shirts.  She also sells flower arrangements, mirrors, frames, makeup, decorations, and other items.  

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and is her fifth transaction with ODEF.  The money will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise such as flowers, frames, decorations, makeup, and clothing for her business.  As a result, her sales and earnings will increase.  Her goal is to continue growing as a person and to help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy flowers, frames, decorations, makeup, and clothing to sell in her business.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is at 22 years old and married, with three children. She runs a general merchandise business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2000, and she sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits in her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Aminata has requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living.

In the future, she would like open a big provision shop.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul is 46 years old and a widow with three children. Her husband died some years ago and she is the primary breadwinner for her family. Eight years ago, Ugul started her own business selling wedding dresses.  Nowadays, she is one of the most successful businesswomen in her town. Ugul knows all aspects of her business very well and her experience and skill have helped her to develop her business and improve her living conditions. Her son helps with her business. Ugul wants to expand her business but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

Ugul is requesting a 3,000 USD loan through IMON to buy a new collection of wedding dresses which will increase her working capital. This will be her fourth loan request. Ugul awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of wedding dresses

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Abibatu from the Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with three children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After the war, Abibatu established her waxed cotton business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Abibatu requires a loan in order to buy more waxed cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future; Mbalu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more waxed cotton for resale.

loans.name: Kasamu Development Group

texts.en:
John is 49 years old. His family includes three children and a pregnant woman. Since 2005, John has been a farmer who grows maize. He started farming to generate income to support his family and his relatives. His customers are Mpigi district dwellers. John’s major business challenges include price fluctuations, poor markets, and transport.

John is requesting a loan to plow his field. In the future, he hopes to plow more fields, hire labor, and buy seeds. John is hardworking, honest, and resilient.

loans.use: to hire labor to plow his fields

loans.name: Natasa

texts.en:
Natasa is 46 years old and married, the mother of an 18-year-old son. Together with her son and husband, she lives in a minority community in Kosovo. Her husband does administration work in a public company, and she has owned her business, roasting coffee, for more than five years. 

She is very satisfied with the income she earns from her business, and she serves all of the people that live in her community and nearby. Natasa is a very hard-worker, opening her store very early in the morning and working until late in the evening. 

Her café machine has been working every day for the last five years, but is beginning to wear out from such extreme use. Since the money she generates from her business is not enough to buy a new machine she is requesting a loan in order to purchase the new one and some coffee for selling. 

The loan will help her to improve her business and gain more customers. She appreciates this help!

loans.use: To buy a badly needed new coffee machine and coffee for her coffee shop

loans.name: Valbona

texts.en: Valbona is 27 years old, a young mother of 2 children ages 3 and 7 years old. She works in administration and her husband works as an economist in a private company, but the money that they generate from their work is barely enough for daily expanses. They are planning to transform the garage in the front of their house into a shop that they will be able to rent out in order to increase their family's income. At this time, Valbona is requesting a loan so that they can prepare and transform the garage quickly and begin renting it soon. This loan will help them to improve the living conditions of her family and she hopes in the future to start her own business so that she can provide her children with a better life and education. She wants to thank all of the lenders!

loans.use: To prepare and transform the garage into a shop to rent out

loans.name: Kpehouton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe KPEHOUTON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Ablawa Pauline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 44 ans. Ablawa Pauline a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Ablawa Pauline est mariée à un commerçant nommé Jules. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ablawa Pauline vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par Ablawa Pauline et son mari. Pour ce faire, Ablawa Pauline achète des bijoux, qu'elle revend par la méthode de distribution depuis trois ans. Ablawa Pauline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Ablawa Pauline s’associe aux autres membres du groupe KPEHOUTON pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group named Kpehouton is made up of three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The leader of the group who is called Ablawa Pauline (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is 44 years old. Ablawa Pauline stopped attending school at the secondary level. Ablawa Pauline is married to a shopkeeper named Jules. The couple has two children, both attend school at their expense. Ablawa Pauline lives with her husband and their children. The household expenses are shared between Ablawa Pauline and her husband. In order to do this Ablawa Pauline buys jewellery, which she has been selling by distribution for three years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. Hoping to consolidate her business, Ablawa Pauline has joined the other members of the Kpehouton group to request a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To buy jewellery.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 57 years old and she lives in Stepanavan city, which is in the Lori region. Anahit is a widow and she has a son who temporally lives and works in the Russian Federation. Anahit and her retired mother live together in a nice and cute flat.

 Kiva lenders already know after Anahit’s first loan that Anahit combines two very different activities; she is a musician (choir supervisor) and she also runs a clothes-trading business. She sells men's, women's and children's clothes in a small rented stall in a city wholesale market. In her business she does everything alone and perfectly overcomes problems connected with her stall, product purchase from Yerevan, its transfer to Stepanavan city and its final sale as well. 

Anahit asks for a loan from Kiva lenders for the second time. This time she needs 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy an autumn-winter clothes collection and organize the sale of it.

loans.use: to buy autumn-winter clothes collection and organize the sale of it

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with seven children. Five of her children are adults while two still attend school. For the past two years, Mary has operated a shop where she sells household goods such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water. Mary decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mary is requesting a loan to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna is 48 years old and married, with a 2-year-old son.  She lives in one of the minority communities in Kosovo. She is a housewife, and her husband is working for the electric company but earns a very low salary, which is barely enough money for them to meet their daily needs with. 

Vesna has often tried to save money and plan ahead for the increased costs that come with winter time, such as increases in electric bills and the necessity to purchase wood for heating, but she been unable to do so with only her husband’s income. 

At this time Vesna is requesting a loan so she can purchase the wood in advance and prepare for the winter. 

Her goal is to find a job in a near future. She promises that she will pay her loan installments punctually and really appreciates the help.

loans.use: To  purchase wood in advance, preparing for the winter

loans.name: Seadet

texts.en:
Seadet is 35 years old. She is married, with a child. Her child’s name is Nihad and he is 13 years old. Nihad goes to seventh class. Seadet’s family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city, but they now live in Asagi Guzlak village of Fuzuli region. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Seadet has been in the animal breeding business for six years. Winter is coming and Seadet wants to buy chaff, hay, and straw for her cows. For this reason, she needs a loan of AZN 2,000 (Azerbaijan New Manat).

Seadet is thankful to lenders and to the Kiva organization for their help. In the future, she wants to build a new stall for her cows.

loans.use: to buy chaff, hay, and straw for her cows.

loans.name: Taron

texts.en:
Taron is 25 years old, and he lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. Taron lives with his mother, who is unemployed. He has a sister who is already married, and she lives with her family. His father is in the Russian Federation as a guest worker. 

Taron has graduated from Yerevan State Economical University. For several years he has worked at the different insurance companies as an insurance agent. Now he works at the gas station as the shift head. 

Taron is very kind and clever young man, and he says he wants to do something that will make his mother happy and which will also make her everyday work easier.  He asks a loan of AMD 250,000 in order to buy a washing machine for his mother, which will be a great surprise and nice gift for her.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine for his mother which will be a great surprise and nice gift for her

loans.name: Sinisa

texts.en:
Sinisa is 42 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. He works in a post office and his wife is a nurse in a clinic. Their salaries are so low that the money they are earning is still barely enough to cover their daily expenses. 

Sinisa is a very hard working man who wants to offer his family a better life. As his home, furniture, and appliances are very old and starting to break, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Euros, which he will use to purchase new furniture and a new stove for his family. Without this loan, he will not be able to replace these items.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and stove

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk lives in the village of Gosh, which is in Tavush region. He is married, and he has a son and a daughter, both of them already students. Hayk’s wife is a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature in their local school. 

Hayk is a worker, and at the same time he is engaged in farming and gardening. In his farm he has three cows, two piglets, 15  chickens, and 15 beehives.  He also cultivates on his plot of land different fruit trees. So together with his wife Hayk manages to sell milk, meat, eggs, honey, nuts, apples, plums, potatoes, etc.

Hayk asks a loan of AMD 400,000 in order to buy three bulls and to increase his farm cattle.  He also plans to buy a lot of animal fodder for his herd.

loans.use: To buy three bulls, increase his farm cattle, and buy a lot of animal fodder for his herd

loans.name: Fernando Antonio

texts.es: Fernando, es un padre soltero de 52 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar en su propio taller de reparación de electrodomésticos pequeños como televisores, teléfonos inalámbricos, radios, entre otros; se capacitó en este campo desde hace 32 años y esto le ha brindado la oportunidad de salir adelante y de brindar el sustento a su hijo. Su horario de trabajo es de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm y tiene la  ventaja de trabajar desde su propia casa y la experiencia que posee, por lo que ya es reconocido en el sector. El cliente se caracteriza por ser un hombre humilde, trabajador y servicial; se levanta diariamente con el ánimo de brindarle siempre lo mejor a su hijo, por ello ve en el crédito un apoyo para seguir avanzando; con el dinero desea comprar herramientas de trabajo, insumos como soldadura y conectores y los diferentes repuestos básicos como micrófonos, leds, cable, entre otros, de esta forma podrá continuar con su labor y ofrecer un buen servicio teniendo disponibilidad de los insumos y repuestos necesarios, así cumplirá con las expectativas de sus clientes, mejorando los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Fernando desea seguir trabajando arduamente para sacar adelante su negocio y lograr que sea más rentable, además sueña con poder capacitar a otras personas en esta actividad y así dejar un legado importante, con el que su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar cuando él ya no esté.
texts.en:
Fernando is a single father, 52 years of age, who is dedicated to working in his own shop repairing small electrical appliances such as televisions, cordless telephones, and radios, among other things. He learned this skill some 32 years ago and this has given him the opportunity to get ahead and offer his son sustenance.

Fernando's daily work hours are 8:00 am to 8:00 pm and he has the advantage of working from his own home plus the experience he possesses, for which he is recognized in the sector. Fernando is characterized by his humility, hard work, and dedication to service. 

Fernando rises each day with the desire to offer the best to his son, and he see the loan as an opportunity to continue advancing. With this money he wishes to buy work tools, inputs such as solder and connectors, and different basic replacement parts such as microphones, leads, and cable among other things. In this manner, Fernando wants to continue his work and offer good service, having available the inputs and parts necessary. Thus he will satisfy customer expectations, improving the income he receives for his labor.

Fernando wishes to continue working hard in order to advance his business and whatever will be most profitable. In addition, he dreams of being able to train other people in this activity and, thereby, leave an important legacy with which his son will have a better quality of life and wellbeing when Fernando is no longer there.

loans.use: buy work tools, supplies such as solder and connectors, and different basic replacement parts such as microphones, leads, and cable among other items.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is 22 years old and married. He has two people of hs family members whom he supports. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer, and he sells clothes. He has been in this business for one year, which is located at Uziwa. In his business he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is taking his first loan of KES 30,000, which he intends to use in adding stock to his  business by buying clothes, shoes, and waist belts.  

Wilfred will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, and waist belts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase gravel for her business. She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase gravel

loans.name: Rahil

texts.en: Rahil, 29, is married and lives with his family. Rahil is an IDP (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region. He is a hard worker who enjoys being employed as a waiter in an exclusive restaurant and likes to help his family. For this reason, he wants to do some renovations to the house. Rahil is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN for the first time. This loan will help him a lot, because without this help, he would not be able to assist and contribute to his family. In the future, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to do some renovations to his house.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She is an IDP person (internally displaced person). She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family.  For more than nine years, Sevda has practiced crop farming on two hectares of land. She primarily grows vegetables and grains, including onions, wheat, and tomatoes. She also practices cattle rearing. She fattens up both cattle and livestock. 

Sevda is the main provider for her family. Her husband is a construction worker. Sevda needs to do her autumn sowing of wheat and onions, but she does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She is a requesting a loan for 1,700 AZN, which she will use to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis is 27 years old. He lives in the village of Sarigyugh, which is in the Tavush region. He is married, and he has two pretty little daughters. His wife does not work; she takes care of their children. 

Aramayis already two years has his own business. In a small garage he does car repairs, tire repairs, and car-washing services. He also has a small business of selling fish, which is seasonal. He has a small stall on a highway of Yerevan-Tbilisi, and during summer his fish selling is always doing well. 

With coming winter months Aramayis wants buy winter tires, which very soon will be of great demand. He asks a loan of AMD 1,000,000 in order to buy winter tires and some car parts for his work.

loans.use: to buy winter tires to stock and some car parts for his work

loans.name: Surriya

texts.en:
Surriya is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been in the business of sewing clothes for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons, to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is 53 years old and married.  She has been running business of animal sales and purchase for many years. 

She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 41 years old and married, with three children. 

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so she started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to her family’s income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation. 

Currently she is in her fifth loan cycle, and she has requested a loan of PR 25,000 to purchase spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, laces and ribbons in various colors. 

In this way she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, along with buttons, laces, and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer who lives in Kitale, Kenya. She has been farming for eight years growing crops and rearing dairy cows and poultry. Her main source of income comes from the sale of milk and eggs. She enjoys farming because it is the source of income for her family. The challenges she faces are heavy rainfall, which spoils the crops, and crop and livestock pests and diseases.

Mary is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase poultry.  The loan will help Mary increase her income and improve her family's standard of living.  Mary chose Juhudi Kilimo because of its good customer service and the help it accords to farmers. During the Juhudi Kilimo 's required microfinance training session, Mary learned that MFIs help small scale farmers to access loans for improving their farm works.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es: cesar augusto mayor de edad casado con un hijo menor de edad aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona la cual predomina el comercio, el turismo, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grandes del país, cesar es un microempresario el cual tiene dos negocios que consiste en la venta de productos básicos para el hogar(pulpería) donde ofrece productos de consumo en pequeñas proporciones como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, golosinas, productos congelados, detergentes papel higiénicos entre otros mas, también ofrece a sus clientes ropa para adultos y niños, calzados, cosméticos, perfumes, este  negoció lo inicio con capital propio proveniente de ahorros que yo hacía cuando laboraba para una agrícola, y también invierte el dinero de su liquidación debido a que decidí trabajar por su propia cuenta en vista de la falta de una pulpería en el sector el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en su negocio(pulperia), e incrementar su inventario, al igual que adquirir nuevos productos para suplir la demanda de sus clientes cesar desea que al tener más productos en existencia sus ventas van hacer mayores que las actuales y al ofertar otros productos la gente va a comprar en su negocio y por lo tanto sus ganancias van a incrementar. uno de sus sueños es poder acondicionar su casa como ponerle piso ya que en la actualidad es tierra, hacerle habitaciones. En su negocio quiere incrementarlo, ya que él es su fuente de ingresos económico para mi familia.
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto is married and has one minor child still under his charge. He is from one of the towns in Chinandega, an area where there is mostly trade, tourism, and some of the largest industrial facilities in the country.

Cesar is a microentrepreneur running two businesses. One is selling basic household goods: a grocery store where he sells basic goods in small quantities, like rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, candy, frozen foods, detergents, toilet paper, and other items. He also offers his customers adult and children's clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and fragrances. He started his business with capital from his own savings, money he saved up while working for a farming company. He also invested the money from his severance pay, since he decided to work for himself when he realized his neighborhood needed a grocery store. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in his business by increasing his grocery store's inventory, as well as to acquire new products to meet his customers' demand. By having more products in stock Cesar wants to increase his sales and, by offering new products, people will come to shop in his business, so his profit will increase. 

One of his dreams is being able to improve his home. He would like to install flooring, since he currently has dirt floors, and build bedrooms. He also wants to increase his business because he is his family's source of financial income.

loans.use: to buy household products as well as clothing to sell.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is a 22-year-old single man. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen. His business is a cafeteria, which he has been running for a few years.
