Mercedes tiene 62 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio, a una hora de Morropon, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia, se dedican al cultivo y venta de arroz, Mercedes ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para pagar a jornaleros que le ayuden en la cosecha de su producto.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 62 years old. He lives in a district called Buenos Aires, in a community dedicated to agriculture and commerce. This district is located an hour from Morropon, which belongs to the Piura region along the northern coast of Peru. 

Along with his family, Mercedes works cultivating and selling rice. He is asking for a 4,000 Soles loan in order to pay day laborers who will help him harvest his crops.

loans.use: to pay agricultural day laborers

loans.name: Fatima Jokary

texts.es:
Fátima, es una joven de hogar, ella vive con sus padres. En busca de mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar en su casa con los gastos. Emprendió un negocio de venta de ropa y la ubico en su casa, esto le beneficia por qué no paga renta de local, también sale a vender por a las oficinas.
Con la inversión comprara ropa interior (ambos sexos), blusas, camisas, trajes (variedad de colores, estilos y tallas), de esta manera tendrá bien surtida su tienda para aprovechar la época de graduaciones escolares, generándole mayores ganancias con las que cancelara su deuda y aportara más apoyo a sus padres.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para independizarse, pero siempre apoyando a sus padres; tener nuevos clientes y satisfacer a los que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Fátima is a young woman who lives with her parents. She hopes to improve her income and help with her family's home expenses. In order to do so, she began a business selling clothing from her home, which is beneficial as she does not have to rent a store space. She also sells her goods "door to door" at various businesses. 

With this loan, Fátima will buy under garments, blouses, shirts, and suits (in a variety of colors, styles and sizes), and by doing so will stock her business with the items she needs to take advantage of the graduation season. She will thereby generate higher earnings and will be able to pay off her debts and support her family. 

Her dream is to grow her business so she is able to support herself independently, but she will continue to support her family at the same time. She wants to gain new clients and satisfy the ones that she already has.

loans.use: to buy under garments, blouses, shirts, and suits

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a 28-year-old, married woman, who has one child. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells clothes and also has rental houses, from which she derives income. Ever-changing customer preferences and inadequate capital are challenges that affect her business growth. Her dream is to own a modern boutique. She also desires to educate her child up to the University level, She, herself, did not have a chance to go to school, because she was an orphan and lacked money for school fees.

Winnie intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell, ahead of the Christmas season, since the demand is always high during that time.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mario Jesus

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante;gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas.
Por iniciativa propia Mario trabaja como asistente de costos en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Mario se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una moto lineal de segundo uso para transportarse hacia su trabajo, así ahorra un poco de dinero en movilidad y espera poder utilizarlo en un futuro no muy lejano para poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mario, 26, is single and lives in Ica, a city in the Parcona district.  He is hard-working and enthusiastic, committed to getting ahead in the world.  He has a degree in Business Administration, a degree that he got after much hard work and a little help from his parents, too.  
Mario now works as a cost administrator for a local farming business.  He works 8 hours a day and says the way to get ahead is to work hard and never give up.  
Mario wants to thank Kiva lenders for their help and says that he will use this loan to buy a second-hand motorcycle.  He will use the motorcycle to get to work and says that it will save him the cost of taking public transportation.  For the future--sometime soon, he hopes--he wants to be able to buy a house of his own.

loans.use: Para comprar una moto lineal

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house by selling kitchen tools and plates. She is making a good income from selling kitchen tools and plates and wants to buy more stocks with the loan. 

She is living in a town nearby the main road; so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $ 400.

loans.use: to buy kitchen tools and plates.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Doña Natalia tiene 50 años de edad ella es ama de casa y agricultora, con una familia muy numerosa la cual es madre de 12 hijos los cuales 7 están casados en hogares a parte y 5 viven con ella ayudando en los diferentes quehaceres del hogar y en las diferentes actividades del campo. En Compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedica a la caficultura lo que aprendió de sus padres ya que por parte de ambas familias todos son agricultores y su economía depende del campo. Una de las mayores dificultades que presenta dicha actividad es el incremento de precios en cuanto a los insumos que se utilizan para asistir los cultivos de café ya que en el mercado los precios son inestables y varían mucho de manera que el incremento de precios afecta el mantenimiento del café, considerando que la competencia no es un problema ya que cada productor tiene sus clientes por la calidad de producto que cultiva. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 25 minutos de distancia aproximadamente al cual se trasladan caminando.
Sus Sueños son los de mejorar y ampliar sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad, un producto más atractivo para sus clientes y de esa forma generara mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar asegurando la educación de sus hijos y su bienestar. Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento el cual invertirá en la compra de 8 unidades de abono 18-46-0, 3 botes de abono foliar y 16 unidades de nutricafe para asistir y asegurar sus cultivos al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Natalia is 50 years old. She is a housewife and a farmer. Her family is large. She has 12 children, seven of which are married and live in their own homes. The other five live at home and help with the household chores and the different activities in the fields. Along with her life companion she grows coffee something she learned from her parents. Both their families are farmers and depend on the land for their livelihood. 

One of the greatest difficulties that faces the coffee farmer is the increase in price of the supplies that they use to help protect their coffee crops. Also the market prices for coffee are unstable and vary a lot which affects the maintenance of coffee crops. Competition is not a problem as each grower has their own clients according to the quality of the coffee produced. 

Their crops are located 25 minutes away from their home by foot. Their dream is to improve and expand their coffee crops planting a better variety, more attractive to their clients. In this manner they can generate greater revenues for the family and household, assuring the education and well-being of their children 

It is for this reason they are requesting a loan which they will invest buying 8 units of 18- 46-0 fertilizer, 3 bottles of foliar spray and 16 units of nutricafe (another foliar spray) to protect and secure  their crops until the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and foliar sprays to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house, and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, and salt. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Juvita is living in a town nearby a school and her kiosk is located at a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy fanta, coca cola, sprite, sagiko, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora; vive en compañía de su esposo Ascario y sus hijas en la casa que heredaron hace algunos años. Su casa se sitúa en una zona rural alejada del pueblo, la mayoría de la población se dedica a la siembra y crianza de animales. Es donde Carmen tiene la idea de abrir una tienda de productps comestibles donde pueda vender alimentos de primera necesidad para sus clientes, ya que no hay otra igual y la mayoría tiene que recorrer kilómetros para comprar alimentos. Durante todos estos años aprendió sobre el negocio además de atender a sus clientes y tener su tienda surtida y con todo tipo de alimentos. Planea mejorar su tienda y ampliarla con más productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con KIVA, durante todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, agradece la oportunidad financiera que le ayudará a mejorar. Carmen, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, golosinas, bebidas y si el dinero le alcanza comprará también útiles de escritorio.
texts.en:
Carmen, who is 46, is a hard worker. She lives with her husband Ascario and their daughters in a house they inherited a few years ago. Their house is located in a rural area far from the village. Most of its residents work farming and raising animals.

Carmen's idea was to open a grocery store here where she would sell basic food items to her customers, since there was no other such store in the area and most people had to travel kilometers in order to buy food. Over the years, she learned the business and served her customers well by keeping her store well stocked with all kinds of food. She plans to improve her store and expand it to include more products.

This is her second Kiva loan. During all this time, she has shown responsibility in paying her installments. She is grateful for this financial opportunity, which will help her improve. Carmen will invest the 1,500 soles in purchasing rice, sugar, milk, candy, drinks, and if there is enough money she will also buy office supplies.

loans.use: to buy food items like rice, sugar, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, powders, sandals, creams and other items for her business

loans.name: Adiel Guni

texts.es:
Adiel tiene 20 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres en Piedra Del Toro una zona rural de Morropon, a dos horas de Piura, costa norte del Perú, de un clima cálido donde su población se dedica al comercio de ganado vacuno y cultivos de arroz y maíz.

Adiel es un joven emprendedor, brinda el servicio de transporte a pasajeros desde el Caserío Piedra Del Toro hacia los caseríos aledaños y viceversa, El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para pagar por el mantenimiento a su vehículo comprando una carpa y llantas y de esta manera brindar un servicio seguro a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Adiel is 20 years old and lives with his parents in Piedra Del Toro, a rural area in Morropon two hours away from Piura on the northern coast of Peru. This region has a very warm climate, and its population is dedicated to raising livestock and cultivating rice and corn. 

Adiel is an entrepreneurial young man, who works transporting passengers from the center of town to the outskirts and vice versa. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Soles which he will use to pay for maintenance of his vehicle. He plans to buy a new tarp and tires, in order to provide his clients with better service.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle by buying a new tarp and tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories and Gulf abayas for her business

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en:
Ghazi is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He is a soldier, getting a low salary. He intends to buy home improvements for his house, but he does not have enough money to buy what he needs. 

Ghazi applied for a loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy furniture for his house. He hopes to establish a retail shop in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flour, meats, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Becoming a business administrator has always been Wilson's dream. Wilson is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards his degree in business administration. He plans on graduating in February, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Wilson plans to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in business administration before graduating. With a degree in business administration, he expects to earn $15 a day. 

Unfortunately, Wilson's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Wilson is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Wilson's father works as a vendedor (vendor), and his salary is the family's primary source of income. Wilson currently works as an ayudante (assistant) to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
José, es un hombre emprendedor que lucha por salir adelante con su familia, él está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, uno de ellos ya inicio la escuela. Sus actividades económicas son una tienda en la que ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, la crianza de cerdos y siembra de granos básicos; son oficios que aprendió de su padre, junto a su compañera de vida inician la jornada a las 6:00 a.m. y la finalizan a las 3:00 p.m. Ambos tienen experiencia por lo que se organizan bien para salir a tiempo con sus actividades. 
Con el préstamo surtirá su tienda comprara artículos de la canasta básica e insumos agrícolas (plaguicidas, herbicidas, abonos), le dará la oportunidad de ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, generara los ingresos que necesita para pagar las deudas, y preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz y frijoles.
Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en un ambiente con mejor alimentación, salud y una educación superior.
texts.en:
José is an enterprising man who strives to get ahead with his family. He lives with his life partner and their two children, who are ages seven and three. One of them already started school. His business is a store where he sells basic goods, but he also works raising pigs and growing basic grains. He learned these trades from his father. Alongside his partner, he starts his workday at 6:00 am and finishes at 3:00 pm. They both have experience, so they are well organized and coordinate their businesses well. 

He will use this loan to purchase basic goods and farming supplies (pesticides, weed killers, and fertilizer). This will give him a chance to offer more products to his customers and generate the income he needs in order to pay off his debts. He will also be able to prepare the land before planting corn and beans.

His dream is to see his children living in an environment where there is better nutrition, health, and a higher education.

loans.use: to buy basic grocery items and farming supplies.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 30 years old, and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better after having received her first loan. Now, she is applying for her second loan, this one in the amount of $1,000 US. She will use it to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, eggs and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store, such as milk, eggs and biscuits

loans.name: Linne Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Linne es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de helados desde hace 3 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también vende en lugares cercanos donde recorre ofreciendo su producto. 
Doña Linne necesita el préstamo para la compra de helados de fresa, mango, chocolate, vainilla y conos para seguir realizando su trabajo, el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar.
Doña Linne con el préstamo espera mejorar su negocio ya que este esté posee una gran demanda de tal manera que sus ventas aumenten de forma y le genere los ingresos necesarios para poder mejorar un poco sus calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Linne espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2013
texts.en:
Linne is a very hardworking and responsible person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. For the past three years her business has been selling ice cream from her home located in the municipality where she lives.  She also sells ice cream in nearby locations, where she walks around selling her product.
Linne needs this loan for the purchase of strawberry, mango, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream, and ice cream cones, so that she can continue doing her work. Her work helps her a lot because the profits are very useful in her home.
With this loan, Linne hopes to improve her business, since there is already a high demand. Her sales should increase and generate increased revenue in her home, which is needed to improve her and her family’s quality of life.
Linne hopes to grow her business in a short period of time, so that she can continue supporting her family, and her children can get the education needed for them to have better opportunities in their lives.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2013

loans.use: to purchase strawberry, mango, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream, and ice cream cones for her business

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Doña Martha Lidia se encuentra muy feliz y agradecida con Dios por haber en su primer financiamiento comprado 10 sacos de abono y haber pagado mano de obra calificada para limpieza de sus cultivos de café, aplicando el abono comprado ya que el área que ella pudo asistir es de 2 Manzanas cuadradas con la meta, la fe y la esperanza de lograr obtener una buena cosecha de esta temporada. 

Por lo que hoy solicita un segundo financiamiento para poder ir cumpliendo con sus metas y sus sueños de poder seguir ampliando más sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de ½  Manzana más de tierra ya cultivada con café ya que gracias al apoyo recibido por la cooperativa COMIXMUL en alianza con los inversionistas en KIVA ella ha podido mejorar su calidad de vida ya que su producción de café aumentara y el patrimonio igual por lo que sus ingresos económicos serán mayores. Ella considera que la cooperativa COMIXMUL ha sido el mejor apoyo que ha recibido por lo que está muy comprometido a no quedar mal como beneficiaria ya que sin el apoyo de COMIXMUL ella se sentía sin esperanza de crecimiento económico. Debido a dicha institución sus metas a futuro es recibir más apoyo y poder comprar más terrenos para seguir cultivando y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y así puedan  salir adelante, aprender a trabajar lo propio y valorarlo.
texts.en:
Doña Martha Lidia says that she was very pleased with her last loan.  She used the money to buy10 sacks of manure and to pay a laborer who helped her spread the manure on her land, work that was needed to prepare the land for a new coffee crop.  She hopes the investment will ensure that the new crop will be a good one.  

Doña Martha is now applying for a second loan that she will use to buy more land and plant more coffee.  The help that she has received from the COMIXMUL cooperative and KIVA lenders has allowed her to increase her output of coffee and, in turn, her income and quality of life.  She says that the COMIXMUL cooperative has been a great help to her and she is committed to repaying the loan because without the cooperative's help, she won't be able to continue growing her business.  She hopes future borrowing will allow her to buy still more land, an investment that will improve her life and the lives of her children.

loans.use: to buy land for her coffee business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is an 18-year-old single young man from Deir Al-Balah. He lives with his family in a very simple house in the city. His brother, who provides the sole income for the family, works as a public sector employee for a low income. Mohammad is a student at a local college where he studies Information Technology. He dreams to earn a BA degree and help his family with part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to write his homework and reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Maria Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su nieto en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de frutales mango, naranja, piñas a dos horas de Jaén, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica al comercio de helados, golosinas y venta de comida que ella misma prepara, Orfelina ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de variedad de golosinas, galletas, agua mineral y de esta manera abastecer el kiosco de la zona, donde ella trabaja.
texts.en:
Orfelina is 50 years old. She lives with her grandson in the district of Pomahuaca located in the Cajamarca Region, two hours from Jaén, in the northern mountains of Peru. The climate is hot and the inhabitants grow fruit like mangoes, oranges and pineapples.

Orfelina sells ice-cream, candy and meals that she prepares herself. Orfelina has requested a loan of 500 PEN to buy a variety of candies, biscuits and mineral water and in this way stock the kiosk where she works.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 25-year-old, hard-working man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He is a farmer who mainly grows tea in order to earn a living. He also offers building services and this has enabled him to provide the basics to his family. Unpredictable weather changes and the high cost of sprays affect his output, while his desire is to expand his tea plantation and to become one of the biggest growers in the area.

James intends to use the loan to plant more tea.

loans.use: to plant more tea.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She sells agricultural produce in addition to crop production in order to raise money to support her family.  Like most traders in this business, she is challenged by inadequate capital and unpredictable weather.  Her dream is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. 

Christine is requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en:
Akil is from Iraq. He is a youth client of 23 years of age who is single and lives with his parents and his three brothers. Akil is the only provider for the family.

Akil owns a small shop where he sells structural materials. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained much experience in this field. Akil has a hired employee and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Akil is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to install a sunshade, a display window and to increase his inventory. Akil is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to install a sunshade, a display window and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Maria Leocadia

texts.es:
Doña María Leocadia es un mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación y de crecer  que a sus 57 años de edad tiene un matrimonio sólido y de él tiene 5 hijos los cuales 4 de ellos son casados y en hogares a parte viviendo con ella nada mas una hija la cual ayuda en los diferentes oficios del hogar. Con un grado de educación primario incompleto cursado hasta el cuarto grado ella agradece mucho en esfuerzo de sus padres a pesar de las dificultades y de las pocas opciones en cuanto a centros de estudios que había en la comunidad. Junto a sus esposo se dedica a la agricultura y lo apoya más una vez llegada la recolecta del grano ya que el trabajo de campo es cansado y un poco pesado para ella. Sus cultivos están ubicados a una distancia de 5 kilómetros al cual se trasladan caminando para poder asistirlo en el cual se involucran sus hijos.
Ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, foliares, formula cafetalera con lo dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café logrando obtener una buena cosecha de esta temporada.   
Sus planes son los de poder mediante la compra de los insumos asistir sus cultivos de café y seguir ampliando más su plantación mejorando los ingresos para su familia y fortaleciendo el patrimonio para su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María Leocadia is an enterprising woman with a strong drive to get ahead in the world.  She is 57 years old and can count on a solid marriage for support.  She has 5 children, 4 of whom are married and live away, with only one daughter still at home.  She left school after the fourth grade and even that was tough given the pressing need for all hands at home and the few options for schooling then available.  

Doña María and her husband are farmers.  Her fields are 5 kilometers from her house and she can only get there on foot.  Her children help when they can, but farming is exhausting and too much for her sometimes.  Doña María is applying to the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan that she use to buy the supplies she needs--fertilizers, manure, weed-killers, etc.--for her next coffee crop.  The investment will allow her to buy the supplies she needs to carry on the business and grow more coffee.  The more coffee she grows, the more income she will generate to support and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, tealeaves and utensils.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 53-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer, but is also involved in the transport business in order to meet his daily family expenses. 

Unpredictable weather changes, price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business plan, while his dream is to venture into modern farming. His personal goal is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

Thomas intends to use the loan facility to buy herbicides and pay workers who are planting tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and pay workers who are planting  tomatoes.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Jacinta to improve her business. She is married, and she has three children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, beer, biscuits, fish and slippers. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2005. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Jacinta independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. 

She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people for improving her living condition for the future.

loans.use: to buy water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, beer, biscuits, fish and slippers.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Célibataire mr Kodjo est revendeur de batteries pour voiture dans la zone portuaire. Il a démarré en 2008, et s'approvisionne au même lieu. Il voudrait à l'avenir, étendre son activité en louant une boutique et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: Kodjo is unmarried and a reseller of car batteries in the port area. He began his business in 2008, and stocks up in the same area. In the future, he would like to expand his business by renting a shop and, later, getting married.

loans.use: to purchase batteries

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará es una zona de clima cálido que su población se dedica al cultivo de frutarles, arroz, café, cacao a dos horas de la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ell es una madre emprendedora, con la ayuda de su hija se dedican a la venta de frutas y gaseosas, su negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio; Flor ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de golosinas y de esta manera tener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is 31 years old, and lives in her parents’ house with her daughter in the Pucara district. Since it is in a warm climate, the population works in the farming of fruit trees, rice, coffee, and cocoa, two hours from the Jaen Province, which is part of the Cajamarca Region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

She is an entrepreneurial mother, and gets help from her daughter. They sell fruit and soda pop. Their business is located in their home; Flor has asked for a loan of 500 PEN to invest in the purchase of snacks, so that she can have additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy snacks

loans.name: Enagnon Hinde Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON HINDE est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Avocehoué (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 45 ans. Avocehoué n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Avocehoué est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Sévérin. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Avocehoué vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. C'est pour cette raison que Avocehoué vend du maïs et des savons de façon ambulante et à son domicile. Avocehoué s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Avocehoué s’associe aux autres membres du groupe ENAGNON HINDE pour solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Enagnon Hinde group is made up of five people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the group is Avocehoué (pictured with her hand raised in the photo) who is 45 years old. Avocehoué did not attend school. She is married to a shopkeeper named Sévérin. Together they have three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom they support. 

Avocehoué lives with her husband and children and together the couple provides for the household expenses. It is for this reason that Avocehoué sells corn and soap from door to door and from her home. She stocks up at a market in Benin. In order to grow her business, Avocehoué has partnered with the other members of the Enagnon Hinde to request a second loan from ALIDé. Their previous loan has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to purchase corn and soap

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig is 46 years old. He has been married for 18 years. His family is from Fuzuli city and now lives at Boyuk Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region. For already 20 years, Rafig’s family has been IDP (internally displaced persons) from their native land, Fuzuli city. Rafig’s wife is a doctor. He has two sons; his elder son goes to tenth class and his other son goes to seventh class.

Rafig is a taxi driver. He transports passengers in the local Fuzuli region. Today he wants to increase his business; therefore, he has applied for a loan from Kiva in the amount of 400 AZN for repair of his car’s salon (interior).

He is thankful to Komak and the Kiva organization for help. In the future, he wants to repair his old house.

loans.use: to repair his car’s salon (interior).

loans.name: Housam

texts.en:
Housam is a hardworking 29-year-old married youth client from Iraq. He has two children and works to provide their living.

Housam owns a garage, where he specializes in repairing damaged body parts of vehicles. He established his business in 2004, and now he has a hired employee. Housam is well known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices.

Housam is requesting a youth loan of 1,200 USD. He will use this loan to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his job. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to provide a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment for his job.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala was born in 1982. She is married and lives with her husband and five children in a sector of Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband works at a governmental entity. Hala has been selling blankets for one year. She started her business by selling a small quantity of them and she found it to be profitable. 

Now, she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets to sell during winter and to earn better income that will help her financially support her family. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima was born in 1990. She is married and lives with her husband and daughter at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband is in the military. 

Fatima has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project with selling a small quantity of them, and she found it profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of blankets to sell during winter. She wants to earn a better income that will help her support her family financially, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her early 50s, is married with six children; three of them are still in school. She has been running sever businesses, selling fish, tea with bites, and cooked food daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Zainabu's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on fish and restore the missing items in the food store.  She has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses, and save some in the bank. 

She really appreciates the loan, and gives thanks to all who have supported her and her group. She will use this loan to buy more fish, rice, backing flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil. She dreams of building a place where she can be selling cold drinks.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group, Bahari, which has nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish, rice, backing flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nictor

texts.en: Nictor is a Ugandan married man aged 21 living in Kagadi, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling motorcycle spare parts where he generates income. He hopes to build a house for his family in the future. He describes himself as a hardworking man though competition from similar businesses hinders his business growth. Nictor is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman was born in 1984. She is married and lives with her husband and three children in a sector of Jordan called Dair Alla. Iman has been running her mini-market for two years. She started her project by selling a small quantity of food products, and she found it profitable. 

Now Iman wants to stock her mini-market with a larger amount of food products to earn better income to help her support her family financially. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more goods for the store.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Helena to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2004 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as beer, oils, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, fish, and slippers. 

She is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, oils, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, milk, biscuits, fish, and slippers.

loans.name: Tabara's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois est créé le 29 mars 2013 et compte vingt six membres qui habitent le même village et mènent comme principales activité le maraîchage, l'élevage et le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou la présidente est âgée de 63 ans. C'est une femme mariée mère et grand mère ; elle a huit enfants tous mariés sauf deux garçons et quatre petits enfants. Elle a une boutique à domicile et fait parallèlement du maraîchage. Elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou vert. 

Elle s'approvisionne en tomate, sucre, lait,thé, café, bonbons etc.... dans une ville pour recharger sa boutique. Elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 30 ans dans ce domaine.

Son prêt lui servira à renforcer son activité de commerce.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle parvient à gérer ses besoins, aider ses enfants et leurs familles; mais aussi épargner. Une partie des bénéfices lui sert de fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created March 29, 2013 and is made up of twenty-six members who live in the same town. They are in the business of vegetables, raising livestock, and small businesses.

Fatou is the president of the group and is 63 years old. She is married and both a mother and grandmother; she has eight children, all of whom are married except for two of her sons, and she has four grandchildren. Fatou runs a shop out of her home and is also in the vegetable business. She is pictured standing on the right in a green "boubou."

Fatou stocks up on tomatoes, sugar, milk, tea, coffee, candy, etc. in the city to replenish the stock of her shop. She has had over 30 years of valuable experience in this field. She will use her loan to expand her business. With the profits, she will take care of her needs, help her children and their families, but also put some into savings. A portion of her profits will increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale

loans.name: Moise

texts.en:
Moise is 55 years old. He is married with two children. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Hospis

texts.en:
Hospis is 25 years old. He has been running the business for the past five years. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac used the previous loan to buy agricultural produce to sell. He is a 41-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture, he started a produce business ten years ago. With the proceeds he has been able to build rental houses to supplement his income. He has also continued to do farming.

Isaac intends to use this loan to buy cassava to sell. Weather and bad roads affect his business projections, and his dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Isaac dreams of educating his six children and buying a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 48 years old. He has seven children aged between six and fifteen, all of whom go to school. He would like to use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer for rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past one year, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites high cost of maintenance as being his major challenge. 

With KES 20,000, he wants to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint his motorcycle.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha was born in 1968. She is married and the mother of three. Her husband is an outdoor salesman. Maha has been planting cactus and small plants in pottery that she makes by decorating them for five years. She started her project with a small amount of money. Then she started attending bazaars and showrooms to offer her products. Now she wants to buy a larger amount of the needed raw materials for her project in order to be more productive and to expand it to earn better profits that will help her assist her husband in covering their children's needs. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy the needed materials for making pottery and planting cactus in them

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 46 years old, married, and has 3 sons. He works hard to provide for his family's needs all by himself. Arzu is a grocer, and owns a small grocery store where he provides his neighborhood with dairy products, canned foods, snacks, drinks and detergents. 

He has been in this field since 1993. After gaining all the needed experience and knowing the market, he established his own independent business, and now he has a hired employee already. Arzu is well-known in the area, thanks to his good products and affordable prices.

The purpose is to renovate his grocery store. He wants to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to educate his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old. He is a father of six children, ages between three and twelve. He has been in the business for the past thirteen years. He would like to use Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 37 years old. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer for rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Paola Del Pilar

texts.es:
Paola del Pilar tiene 21 de edad, vive junto a su familia en Pampa de los Silvas una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, donde su población se dedica al comercio de animales menores y alimentos preparados con insumos de la zona, esta comunidad pertenece a Morropon, que se encentra ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Desde hace dos años Paola se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora muy conocida por su labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de insumos y depósitos adecuados para transportar y ofrecer su producto a zonas aledañas a su distrito, generándole ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Paola del Pilar, age 21, lives with her family in Pampa de los Silvas.  This is a rural area in the La Matanza district.  The population sells small animals and food prepared with supplies from the area.  This community is in Morropon, which is located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

Paola has been selling ‘chicha de jora’ [a traditional, corn-based drink] for two years.  She is very well-known for the work that she does.

She is requesting a loan for 3,000 soles to buy supplies and containers that are adequate for transporting and offering her products in the areas outlying her district.  She will be generating additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make 'chicha' and for containers.

loans.name: Hut

texts.en: Hut is 48 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by farming rice and cassava in a rural area of Baray district, Kampong Cham province. She learned to do this from older people and her parents and has been in this business for more than 33 years. Hut aims to improve the current business, but she has inadequate capital to make it possible. In this regard, she has requested a loan of KHR 2,200,000, which she will add to her savings, to buy a piece of farmland to enlarge her farming area. She hopes to have better yields to provide a secure future for her family. She thanks lenders for their generosity towards a poor fellow like her.

loans.use: to buy a piece of farmland to enlarge her farming area.

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es:
Santos, ha decidido seguir trabando con créditos por lo que está solicitando nuevamente capital para invertir en la compra herbicidas, abono, semilla, plaguicidas, etc., todo esto es lo que necesita para preparar muy bien el terreno y tener una buena cosecha. 
Con el crédito anterior su productividad aumento, el área de siembra fue más grande, sus ingresos mejoraron notablemente con los que cancelo a tiempo su crédito y cambio la alimentación, salud de su familia, sigue siendo el mismo núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Santos has decided to keep working with loans, so he is once again requesting new capital to invest in the purchase of herbicides, fertiliser, seeds, insecticides, etc. This is what he needs to prepare well the land and to have a good harvest.

Thanks to the previous loan Santos' productivity increased, the planted area was larger, and his income improved notably. He used this to repay his loan on time and to improve the nutrition and health of his family, which consists of the same members as before.

loans.use: To buy herbicides, fertiliser, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy detergents and cereals.

loans.name: Sreypao

texts.en:
SreyPao is 59 years of age. She is widowed and a mother of three children living with her in Bakan, Pursat province. SreyPao raises her children by getting involved in farming activities. She manages a subsistence farming, primarily growing rice on her own farm. Having worked in this field for years, she is able to make a normal income of USD 10 per day.

SreyPao wants to gain access to water and sanitation and improve her living standard, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to build a latrine and water storage for her household. This will allow her family members to live in healthy, comfortable conditions. 

Thanks lenders for distributing their funds in a program like Kiva via its partner, HKL, to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and personal hygiene. For water loan product, HKL has provided her a special interest rate and suitable loan terms than its general products.

loans.use: to build a latrine and water storage for household.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old and married.  She has a retail kiosk to generate income for her family. 

She has been contemplating how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital.  She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is now applying for her second loan of $1,000.  She will use it buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, oils and vegetable dishes. 

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin), which offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, oils and vegetable dishes.

loans.name: Jose Ilder

texts.es:
José Ilder tiene 21 años de edad, vive junto sus padres en San Isidro una zona rural de Callayuc , sus pobladores se dedican al cultivo de caña y café, a dos horas de la ciudad de Cutervo, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El es un joven emprendedor desde hace 5 años se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, que es el proceso de hervir la caña de azúcar, Jose Ilder ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para inversión en el cultivo de caña, permitiéndole a obtener mayor materia prima para lograr destilar mas aguardiente y de esta manera generarle mayores ingresos que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Ilder, age 21, lives with his parents in San Isidro, a rural area in Callayuc.  Its inhabitants grow sugarcane and coffee.  It is two hours from the city of Cutervo, and it is in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He is an enterprising young man, who has been distilling liquor for five years.  This is the process of boiling the sugarcane.

José Ilder has requested a loan for 2,000 soles to invest in the sugarcane crop.  This will allow him to have greater raw material in order to manage to distill more liquor.  This way he will generate more profits, which will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the sugarcane crop.

loans.name: Elieka

texts.en:
Elieka lives in Kongowea area, north of Mombasa Kenya. She is a 26-year-old married business lady with two children. She has been in the dressmaking business for the last three years, and the business has been improving. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now seeks a loan to buy lining materials and buttons. She has been getting support from her husband since she started the business, and she is happy. She hopes that in the next five years, she will graduate into a full designer, and stock her shop with all kinds of clothing. 

The challenges that she faces in the business are competition and high cost of materials. The income that she will raise from the business will improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy lining materials and buttons.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married man who is very hardworking and responsible. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past year, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites the high cost of maintenance as his major challenge. 

With the KES 15,000 he wants to purchase spare parts and paint for his motorcycle. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint for his motorcycle

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer was born in 1982.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in a region in Jordan called Salt.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  

Abeer has been selling wedding dresses and clothing for three years.  She started her project by selling a small quantity of them and she found that it was profitable.  Now she wants to buy a larger amount of wedding dresses and other items of clothing to earn a better income that will help her support her family financially.  But, because she does not have enough money to buy these items, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses and clothing for her business

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en:
Nzingo is a business woman who is very hardworking. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Nzingo has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 70,000, she wants to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase twenty sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1979. He is married and lives with his house wife and 4 children at a sector in Jordan called Rsaifeh. Even though Mohammad’s arms are amputated, he was able to continue his life normally and has been running his mini market since 4 years. He started his project with selling a small quantity of food products, and he found it profitable. Now he wants to stock his mini market with a larger amount of food products to earn better income that will help him support his family financially. But, he does not have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for his mini market.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is 19 years old. He lives in a sector of Jordan called Madaba with his four siblings and his parents. His father is a retired man who currently works as a sponsor, and his mother works at a bank. 

Karam is studying for a Bachelor of Literature. He is in his second year. He is planning to continue his study, and to find a job in his field of study after graduation to start earning a better income to help his family financially. However, he doesn't currently have enough money to pay the fees for his upcoming semester. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay the fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is 27 years old, married and the mother of five children. She opened a small store thirteen years ago with $50 of her own money. She is a hardworking woman who earns a good income from her business.

Madalena is applying for a 1000 USD loan through Tuba Rai Metin to buy stock for her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, oil, noodles, milk, eggs, fish, body lotion, cookies, soft drinks such as Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and Sagiko, beer and cigarettes. She wants to grow her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married with three children, two of whom are in school and one who is still too young to attend. The family lives in a rental that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years Caroline has sold khangas, or wrap cloths for women. Inflation is her major business challenge.

Caroline decided to join Yehu to access loans that would help her in her business. She is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy more khangas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more khangas to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 24 years old. He is engaged. He would like to use this Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 28 years old and she is married with one child. She is now applying for a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She opened her second-hand clothing business in 2000 with her own working capital of $90. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as shirts (long sleeve, short sleeve), long pants, shorts and skirts. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts (long sleeve, short sleeve), long pants, shorts and skirts.

loans.name: Rosendo Antonio

texts.es:
Rosendo, es un joven de 23 años está acompañado, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 3 años, vive en una casa familiar junto a sus padres, su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, oficio que le enseño su padre, lo ejerce de forma independiente desde hace 5 años, de lunes a sábado, inicia desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., es él quien genera los ingresos para que su familia tenga lo necesario y no tenga carencias.
Comprará abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semillas, para que su cosecha sea abundante y le de ganancias que utilizara para pagar el préstamo y apoyos más en los gastos de su hogar.
Anhela ampliar su negocio para que su economía mejore y darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos lleno de oportunidades que les permitan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosendo is a 23 year-old youth who lives with a partner and has 2 children aged 5 and 3.  He lives in a family home with his parents, his life partner, and his children.  He cultivates staple grains.  His father taught him to farm, and he has been farming independently for 5 years.  He works Mondays through Saturdays from 6am until noon.  He is the one who generates the income that ensures that his family has everything they need.

With this loan, he will buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides and seeds, so that his harvest will be abundant and will give him the earnings to pay off the loan and contribute more to the household expenses.

Rosendo wants to expand his business so that his finances will improve to give his children a better future, one that is full of opportunities that will allow them to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Samoeun is 35 years old and has two children, both of whom are in school. Samoeun is in the agriculture business, farming rice on his own land in Bakan district, Pursat province. He manages the business with the help of his wife and children. Having worked in this business for years, he is able to generate an income of $10.00 per day.

Currently, his family does not have a safe toilet to use, so he would like to build a toilet to improve the health of his family. At the same time, he aims to build water storage at home in order to ensure enough water for the household. For this reason, he has applied for a loan of 1,500 USD from HKL. He thanks lenders for contributing their own money in a program like Kiva via its partner, HKL, to help low-income people gain access to sanitation and increase their personal hygiene. For this kind of loan product, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate different from its general products.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy handbags and mobile bags

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos, en el distrito de Oyotun, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña, maíz, algodón y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican desde hace 10 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallinas, cuyes, ovejas, Miguel ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 200 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and 4 children in Oyotun district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on Peru's North Coast. The people here grow sugar cane, corn, cotton and raise small animals.

Miguel together with his family have spent the last ten years raising and selling small animals, ducks, chickens, guinea pigs and sheep. Miguel has requested a loan of 1200 PEN to buy balanced feed to fatten the animals. In this way he can offer a better price to his clients, generating greater revenue for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
Theogene, 25, is single. He would like to use his Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, and cookies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap-making powder.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta, de 47 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace algunos años. Todos los días junto a su esposo, salen a cuidar sus sembríos de maíz y papa en sus terrenos propios, los que cuida con mucho esmero por que le gusta la agricultura, además construyó en su casa un vivero, donde siembra diversas hortalizas y vegetales, esto le sirve a ella para su propio consumo, “así no gasto mucho en los alimentos de mis hijos, además son de calidad pues son orgánicos”, comenta. En época de cosecha, comercializa sus productos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde ella misma lleva a vender sus alimentos, ya que es conocedora del lugar y los negociantes. Ahora posee 2 vacas que piensa alimentar y engordar para poder extraer leche y así realizar queso, espera concretar su nuevo proyecto, pues quiere comercializarlos en la ciudad, aprovechando los viajes que realiza para comercializar sus propias cosechas. Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz, pues tiene el capital necesario para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida. Modesta, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Modesta at 47 years old is a simple woman. She lives in company with her children who she cares for in the house that she bought a few years ago. Every day along with her husband she goes out to care for their corn and potato crops grown on their own land. 

She enjoys agriculture and gives special care to her plants. She has also built a greenhouse at her house where she plants a variety of vegetables and produce. These are used for their own consumption. "thus we don't spend a loft on feeding our children, plus as they are organic they are of high quality". At harvest time she sells her product in the city of Huancayo. She takes the product there herself so she is knowledgeable about the city and business.

She now has two cows which she is thinking of feeding and fattening in order to produce milk which she would use to make cheese. She hopes to  carry out this new project as she would sell the cheese in the city, taking advantage of the trips she makes selling her harvests. 

This is Modesta`s first loan with Kiva and she is pleased as she has the money she needs to improve her business and in the end her quality of life. Modesta will invest the loan buying organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Shoroq

texts.en:
Shoroq is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her brother appears in the photo

Shoroq is a 20-year-old single young lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small and simple house. Shoroq's father is a worker in the construction field where he gets a good income but not a stable one due to the market demand. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Shoroq is a student in her third year at a local university. She studies pharmaceuticals. She would like to finish her studies and find a job in the future. 

Shoroq took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her in writing her reports and homework.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania is a 17-year-old single young lady from Gaza city. She lives with her family in a small and simple house. Dania's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Dania is a student in her first year at a local university. She studies Information Technology. She would like to finish her studies and find a job in the future.
 
Dania took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. This will help her in writing her reports and homework. 

Dania appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Cornel

texts.en: Cornel lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 38 years old and a carpenter by training. He has done carpentry for the last three years and the business has been growing ever since he started it. He has ambitions to own a showroom that will showcase his work. He learned of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy timber for the business. The major challenge in the business is the cost of transportation that has been cutting his income. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is a 19-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Hussien's father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Hussien is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies Physical Education. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Hussien took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Hussien appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Saji

texts.en:
Saji is a 17-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Saji's father is a plumber. It is a good business but not stable. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Saji is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies Business Administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Saji took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Saji appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 17-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Moath's father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Moath is a student in his first year at a local university. He studies commerce. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Moath took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. 

Moath appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 18-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Mohammad's father is a paint worker. It is a good job but the income is not stable. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad is a student in his first year in a local university. He studies Educational Science. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nadi

texts.en:
Nadi is a 22-year-old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small and simple house. Nadi's brother works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Nadi is a student in his last year in a local university. He studies business administration. He would like to finish his studies and find a job in the future. 

Nadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him in writing his reports and homework. Nadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Adriana Milena

texts.es: Adriana, con 38 años de edad, es una madre soltera de 3 hijos. Durante su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en el área comercial y, desde hace 10 años pudo adquirir una tienda de abarrotes ubicada la frente de la casa donde reside, allí trabaja solo todos los días, gracias a la experiencia que tiene en el manejo de este tipo de establecimientos, ya que algunos de sus familiares se dedican a esta actividad; ofrece todo tipo de productos para la canasta familiar y, de esta manera ha generado los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Sus principales desafíos son la competencia que hay en el sector y lograr mantener a su familia con los ingresos que obtiene; sin embargo, la cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activa y trabajadora y, siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, cervezas, mecato, entre otros), lo que le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos disponible para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, permitiéndole tener más ventas y mejorar los ingresos que recibe por su labor. Adriana sueña con formalizar su negocio, acreditarlo y, en un futuro poder comprar un local para no tener que seguir pagando arriendo, pues es muy costoso y afecta las finanzas familiares; haciendo esto podrá brindar un mejor bienestar y educación a sus hijos y tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecerles una estabilidad económica y calidad de vida favorable.
texts.en:
Adriana, 38, is a single mother with three children.  Throughout her working life she has earned a living in the field of commerce.

Ten years ago Adriana was able to acquire a grocery store located in the front of the house where she lives.  She works there alone every day, thanks to her experience running this type of business, because some of her relatives earn a living in this line of work.  She sells all the staple products that families need, generating the income to pay for her basic household necessities.

Adriana's main challenges are the competition in the field and managing to support her family with her income.  Nevertheless, she's known for being strong, active, and hardworking.

Adriana's always looking for new alternatives so she can continue making progress.  This is why she's requesting the support of the loan to buy stock wholesale (soda, beer, snack food, and other things).  This will allow her to have available products to satisfy demand, which increases with the coming Christmas season.  She'll have better sales and improve her income.

Adriana dreams of positioning her business and buying a store in the future so she doesn't have to keep paying rent, which is very costly and affects the family finances.  Doing this, she'll be able to give her children greater well-being and a better education as well as economic stability and a favorable quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new computer for her brother's service office

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 27-year-old married man from a small village near Bethlehem city. He lives with his wife and two sons in a simple house in the city. For the past thirty years, Amir's family has been working in a carpentry workshop they own. Amir gained his experience when he was very young. Amir would like to improve his workshop and meet all the demands in the market.

Amir took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials for his carpentry shop. This will improve his productivity and also his income. Amir appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for his carpentery shop

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
